It was packed with flavor but  I was expecting spicy :0( so I added in some chipotle Tabasco n that just 
made it for me. I had the small n that was just enuf :0)
This place is wonderful for anyone who enjoys seafood. Authentic and casual, Acme has a cajun stylle, with quality dishes, and oysters to die for!

Two words: chargrilled oysters. They are PHENOMENAL. We enjoyed them so much that we came twice for them in the four days that we were visiting NOLA. Expect to wait a minimum of 30 minutes if you go during peak times, but it's SO worth it. We also thoroughly enjoyed raw oysters on the half shell, the Fried Oyster Po'Boy, the Seafood Gumbo, and the Jambalaya. Highly recommend!

Long wait, crowded and loud-- but worth it for the bbq oysters! It is not unusual to see the line around the block, people waiting in the rain and sitting at the bar after trying several different items you'll understand why. It was low-cost well reasonably cost with really great oysters! I loved the fries and would go back. But be prepared it is very loud and cramped.

Came in for an early lunch.  What I did not know was that they know open at 10:30 am instead of the 11am to accommodate the long lines which occur very quickly.  However I was able to grab a seat at the bar right as I walked in and it was already packed.  Started with half a dozen char grilled oysters which was wonderful.  Followed with a fried peace maker po boy which was great, the tabasco mayo and the light and crispy seafood made the sandwich so great.  After this I decided to try the seafood gumbo which was also good.
The chargrilled oysters are amazing!  Best thing I've had in NOLA.  There is a reason there is always a line for this place!

Chargrilled oysters. Everything else was fairly good-- gravy fries, crawfish, jambalaya but those oysters were the best I had the entire time I was in New Orleans. Definitely worth the wait. Plate came out steaming hot and each oyster was bubbling with butter, herbs, Parmesan cheese. Perfectly salted and mouth watering. We ordered another plate after finishing the initial and it came out in the same quality. Amazing. You have to try these, they won't disappoint!

What's the point of writing a review of a place that has over two thousand reviews? Do I have anything to write that hasn't already been written? My friend told me this place would be touristy so I was hesitant to go. But after twelve hours of traveling from Hawaii to NO and so hungry and cold and tired I needed to eat. So I dragged my colleague here from the convention center. It looked quite strange inside, dark with neon signs and checked plastic tablecloths. Then I saw the oysters on the grill and I thought gross cooked oysters. When the waitress suggested the chargrilled oysters i grudgingly agreed bc I wanted to just eat something. 

WOW. They came still sizzling in their shells with a sinfully delicious garlic butter cheese sauce. So good. I have never ever liked cooked oysters until that day. Raw ones were also good. Only got half dozen of each. Wish I had my own dozen of each. Pretty pricey I think around 13 bucks for half dozen but worth it. Had abita beer for first time. Also got some sampler with gumbo, jambalaya, red beans and rice and some kind of sausage. These were fine. I prolly wouldn't get that again. I didn't have any cooked oysters anywhere else during my short stay but I would go back for these.
Best charbroiled oysters I've ever tasted. Really really good. Would go back just for the oysters.

I Yelp the sh*t out of places before I go eat there, reading sometimes up to 30 reviews on each place to get a sense of what they are like. I will include some things in this review I would have found helpful when I was reading up on Acme.

First off, I promised my self I wouldn't review the char grilled oysters because EVERYONE did and ranted about how amazing they were to the point where I was like ok, is there anything else on the menu? I would never eat a cooked oyster. But after the 30th rave review, my friend (who had similar views on cooked oysters) and I gave in and tried them. Worst case we would flush $10 down the toilet. OH MY GAWD, SO GOOD! So here I am doing what I said I wouldn't do and reviewing the char grilled oysters. Do it, even if you think you don't want to. Because you do.

Secondly, the bloody marys are not as good as everyone says they are. They are drinkable and I had two, but you can get better in the walk-up daiquiri bars on Bourbon & Decatur. It didn't meet the hype.

Thirdly, the Roast Beef Debris Po Boy is amazing along with the red beans and rice and ettoufee.  Did not love the gumbo as it was a bit fishy.

Lastly, when I Yelp restaurants in unfamiliar areas I find myself always looking for good restaurants in the general vicinity of the ones I was Yelping to help with tomorrow nights dinner destination.  Your choices are here: Desire, Coffee Pot and Mothers.  

There. Go Eat.

I visit Louisiana at least once a year and this place is always a MUST have for me.  Depending on the time of day, there might be a line, but the Chargrilled Oysters are worth the wait.

I last visited on July 8th and enjoyed the great service that was given to us by our waitress Alisha.  She took care of us and we didn't have to ask for anything twice.

If I hear anyone I know is planning a visit to Nola, I always highly suggest they try this place.

Nothing fancy... just great service and great food.
I'm not a big oyster person.  But holy cow are they AMAZING here!  Chargrilled to perfection!! Even if you think you don't like oysters, try them herr!!

It's alright.  Just another money vampire in New Orleans.be sure to try the rude service and the rush you out of here appetizer, followed by the don't let the door hit you on your way out greeting after you have paid

Best oysters.  Yes, it's crowded, because everyone wants to get in to have these oysters.  The last time I was here, we must have had 3 dozen oysters each with a couple of beers.  The horseradish is so fresh, it burns so good.  This is one of my must visit places to eat while in NO.
My favorite meal in new Orleans was grilled oysters Rockefeller from here. Worth the long wait. Stay away from the other menu items and focus on the oysters.

This is a great atmosphere settle down outside of the heat and enjoy quality oysters freshly shucked.

Enjoy fresh raw or grilled (with parmesan and tasty herb butter) oysters.  Grilled oysters are cooked well, not to the point of being overly dry and shriveled like raisins.  Raw oysters (from a SoCal native) are unlike local Pacific oysters which tend to be larger and have more of a bite and be more on the firm side.  Rather, they are silky smooth with a sweet finish.

Sit down, order AT LEAST a dozen per person grilled or raw (my preference) and just put 'em down the hatch!

This will definitely be a staple for future visits.

Char-grilled oysters are my favorite part of New Orleans! The wait is not that bad because once you get your name down you get called pretty soon after. 

Minus one star for the bread pudding that left much to be desired; it was mushy with little flavor.

Over rated. We went because it was recommended. We went early to avoid the long lines they speak of (around 5:45). Waited about 30 min for a table. Now to the review--- oysters were good. Everything else was average.

Oysters live up to their reputation and the service was ok. My issue with this place was the lack of transparency. It's a high volume place so quality is lacking at times. Sat at the bar had ok service from the bar tenders. Ordered some oysters which were fabulous but then asked the server if the side of rice and beans had sausage and she said no. So I said "so they don't have meat?" She said no. I ended up packing them to go, got to my hotel took a bite and bit into a chunk of meat. Maybe she was confused since I initially asked about sausage? Although when I asked if it had meat in general she should have let me know. I'm only upset because I paid for something I couldn't eat, if I had tried them while I was there and they would've fixed it I probably wouldn't mind, but since I had them in room, they became a loss of money. Beside that I recommend the sweet potato fries, definitely delish

Hype, hype, and more hype! I don't like places that have long lines, but according to my friend, I just had to come here so I did. Luckily, I didn't have to wait too long because we agreed to sit at the bar. When we sat down, the waiter was very standoffish and handed us the menus. I figured he was tired of seeing a million tourists like myself and just wanted to clock out. At any rate, I ordered a glass of white wine and a half rack of chargrilled oysters to start. When my white wine arrived, the cup had lipstick on the rim. I showed my waiter the glass and without even an apology, took the glass from me and handed it to the manager I suppose to get me another lipstick free glass. I told the waiter that I didn't want the wine on second thought and just wanted to oysters. When the oysters came one of the 2 shells was missing meat! I didn't have the energy to complain yet again so I simply proceeded to eat the 4 out of 6 shells of oysters that were on my plate. The oysters were salty at best. I was barely on my last shell before the waiter tried to snatch the plate from my hand as to move me along. We had been that at the restaurant for no more than 17 minutes. And it was 17 minutes too long. Hopefully, Deanie's Seafood Restaurant is open next time I come to NOLA, that is where I really wanted to eat in the first place, but for some reason, they were closed for a whole week. :-\

Came here for lunch on the Saturday before mardi gras. Already a line before they opened, but man was it worth it! The best grilled oysters in all the land. Plenty of butter for the bread after. We sat at the oyster bar where they were shucking oysters while they served us and entertained us with local history. I also had soft shell crab which was delicious. Their southern gentleman drinks will knock you on your butts. Excellent food and a great time. Can't wait to go back.

Holy moly everything was so salty! There was a line to get in (about an hour wait) so I expected great food. Oh Boy... So I ordered a dozen raw oysters ... They was so so. I ordered a cup of gumbo. Oh my it was decent but so salty. I then had a pound of crawfish ($9/lb!) which was salty inside and out, no spiciness either. (At home I can get crawfish cooked Cajun spicy garlic for $4/lb. ) I was disappointed. I also tried the shrimp po boy, jambalaya, grilled oysters.... They all taste like they're soaked in salt. This place is no good for your blood pressure I assure you that!! Service was ok. I would never ever come back here
This was my favorite place I ate at on my vacation to New Orleans. The breading on their deep fried dishes was the best I've had. It was not oily and had flavors added into.

If you come here during meal times, especially on a busy weekend, be prepared to wait. But, if you must wait, then reward yourself with the char-grilled oysters, which are off the hook. If you look behind the bar to where the guys are shucking, you will notice that they set the really big oysters aside. Those are the ones that get char-grilled, because they shrink so much under the heat. They are the tastiest thing on the menu, and you have to get them if you never have. The rest of the food is pretty adequate New Orleans fare. Nothing surprising, and nothing that you can't get better somewhere else.

Line was crazy during Mardi Gras weekend, but it didn't deter me from going 3 times.  Don't waste your time with raw oysters.  Chargrilled all the way.  If your a big eater like me, you can easily house 3 dozen in a sitting.  I also tried the half oyster- half shrimp po boy.  It was decent but stomach space is better utilized with the..yes.. you know it..c-grilled oysters.  Wish all the oysters were on the bigger side though.
Delicious oysters, nothing else all that special though. The gumbo tasted very lemony, though, which I didn't like.

Loved everything!! Must try the grilled and fresh oyster! They both have different uet amazing flavors! my husband and i had a dozen of each! awesome! u can taste the freshness! The crawfish étouffée was heaven! So was the gumbo, red beans and rice and jambalaya!! Everything was delicious and fresh! We wanted to try mote but we definitely had our fill with their good ol' southern portions! :) The line is definitely worth the wait! ;)

Char grilled Oysters!!!
Char grilled Oysters!!!
Char grilled Oysters!!!

Thats all you need to know. The best place in NOLA hands down.

I love oysters and was excited about all the great reviews.  Chargrilled oysters were big but slightly overcooked so they were chewy and a little too salty.  Still good but definitely not the best as all the reviews led me to believe.   Raw oysters had all this sand and dirt in it.  I had to change my platr aftet eating them because my plate had a layer and black sand...

I heard great reviews about this place. With a name like Acme, I had originally thought it was a major chain restaurant and steered away from it the first few days in NOLA. But then a colleague who had visited a few times mentioned it was the best seafood in the area. So I decided to go at 10:30 am, at opening on a saturday. By then, a line was already forming. The place is dimly lit so it's not the most inviting-- i 5hought it would be a bit more upscale, but the food is great. I sat at the bar and had the chargrilled oysters and crawfish puppies. The chargrilled oysters were amazing. They were well flavored with butter, italian seasoning and parmesan. It was like garlic bread but very much accentuated by the oyster. They came out hot and delicious. I was quite a fan of the puppies but I figured I had to try it-- but i figured it would be a toss up given that it's not something I would normally order. I had liked the oysters so much I ordered another half dozen. Also don't forget to use the bread to dip the flavored butter from the half shells. The shucker gave me a complimentary raw oyster. It was large, plump, fresh, and sweet-- definitely something I would recommend. I had a flight later in the day so I avoided anymore raw food. It was a great start to the day.

Went here on a Monday night for dinner around 8:30 and the line was out the door.  Even though it was a holiday, I was told most nights there is a line.  Not sure if the same is true at their 4 or 5 other locations in Louisiana, but being that this location is in the French Quarter, I'm not surprised there is a wait.  At any rate, we didn't wait very long.  Someone came out and took down our name and we probably sat down sometime between 8:45 and 9:00.

The baked oysters were awesome. They're topped with butter, parmesan cheese and something else I wasn't able to identify, but you could make a meal out of these.  I shared some as an appetizer and then moved onto the combo speciality, which entailed your choice of chicken or seafood sausage, gumbo, red beans and rice and jambalaya.  I recommend the platter if you want to try a bit of everything.  The portions weren't huge, but the price was right: $11.  There's also an extensive po-boy option.

Overall, the staff could be a little friendlier, but the atmosphere is casual, the food is good, and the prices are very reasonable.  A place I'd like to go again ...

First time in NOLA but with my bro that has been here many.  We decided to try the ACME since it is so popular. We are not oyster eaters so we went for the seafood etoufee (tonight was shrimp), red beans and rice, and the fried crawfish.  The crawfish appetizer was awesome. I love those little fried tails.  Wouldnlove to have a bucket of em in the movies sometime!
The red beans were disappointing.....did not have much flavor in my opinion.  I must say I did not find the shrimp etoufee much better. Each of these dishes were bested by the French Market the night before. Glad we went so we have Been There. 
Don
't think it will be a repeat though.

There wasn't a huge line outside when we walked in (only a party of two) but the lunch took over an hour because the waitress kept forgetting our order, forgetting to put it in. And when we finally did get our food, the order was wrong. 15 min after we finished eating, we were looking for the waitress to get the check but she was no where to be seen, and the only worker we saw was the person seating people. 

There is a sign hung on here that reads "Waitress available sometimes." It's supposed to be funny, but it's pretty accurate.

2nd trip here & they're still terrific! Sadly though, not serving LA oysters (Texas instead). They're delish, but it's sad (Shame on you BP!) Excellent Po Boy named "The Peace Maker" half oyster, half shrimp, & of course, the kick ass bread they use for Po Boys in this city. Yumscilly! We ate 3 dozen raw, a dozen char grilled (soooo wrong & tasty!) & split the Peace Maker, between just the two of us. Definitely a spot to visit while you're here
Amazing! Best meal I had in NOLA and we had some good food. The po boy was so good I wanted to come back another time. Oysters are huge!!!!
Chargrilled oysters -- best thing I ate on my whole trip. The long line out the door was definitely worth it, especially because there was a jazz band playing in the street outside.
Best bloody mary ever. It's a little dark and dingy inside, but the food is good.

Ordered raw oysters, chargrill oysters, shrimp etouffee, and bread pudding. Raw oysters were great, especially with their cock tail sauce. Chargrill oysters were not too cheesy, they were salty and worked fine with bread coming with the oysters. Shrimp etouffee was alright, nothing special. The sauce for bread pudding was too sweet for me. The pudding itself was fine.

Great oyster place! You have to wait outside to be seated. Extremely busy during dinner. We sat at the bar and the wait staff was amazing. Very sweet and made great recommendations. They have staff shucking oysters right in front of you - very neat to watch. Bang Bang shrimp and charred Oysters were phenomenal! New Orleans MUST!

Great atmosphere and busy place. We sat in the bar, sound a little high. Food was quick n coming. We had the chargrilled oysters. They were slightly overdone and a few was poorly cleaned. The shrimps for the starter was the best we had. Overall a good experience.  To busy of a place for perfection. Will go again.

Super Busy!!! Long line to get in. Took awhile to get our order in, but the food came quickly. Drinks are relatively cheap, and the food was great once we got it.

Hard for people in wheelchairs because others keep on bumping into the chair. It's crowded inside.

Went to this place with the wife and a friend, had an awesome time. When we walked up there was a line down the street. A helpful tip is when waiting on line get a drink but you must finish it up first before you get in because you cant bring it in. We only waited on line for about fifteen minutes so it was great. 

I ordered a doz. oysters, fried crawfish tails, gumbo, and soft shell crab. The crab was amazing, a little too much batter for my liking, don't get me wrong still bomb!

great place I give it 8 out of 10!

Food quality and service top notch. There is a wait (line outside of the door) but it is completely worth it.

Ordered 1 dozen raw oysters and 1 dozen chargrilled oysters. Both excellent. The raw were fresh and the chargrilled came out still sizzling in the shell.

The service is wonderful. We had one server assigned to our table, but we were able to ask anyone who walked by for service (some extra crackers for the table.) Also, everyone helped each other out. If there was an empty dish on the table, whoever was walking by would just pluck it right up.

The hush puppies alone are worth the wait in line. Red beans and rice  most everything we ordered was delicious. However the gumbo wasn't all that.

All in all, worth it. Soooooooo good. Definitely a place I would recommend.

Always a must go in New Orleans. Always a wait but it takes only a few minutes to get in. Raw oysters always good, but you have to have the Grilled oysters. The best. If there is one place you have to go Go here.

Best. Charbroiled. Oysters. Ever! Best oysters ever for that matter. I've had good oysters before but this absolutely blew my mind. 

I had the gumbo and Étouffée, which were average in my opinion. The temperature could have been hotter. They were good, nonetheless. 

The oysters were appetizers but took rather long too cook. We were finished with our entrees before it came out. I was wondering why it was taking so long. I was nearing full and could not eat much more. Then the magic happened. I could not get enough. Seriously. One of the best, if not, best oysters ever. 

We waited for over an hour. I have to say it was worth it. The oysters made it worth it. Again, charbroiled oysters. That is all.

The best chargrilled oysters! We had the oysters, fish, shrimp, jambalaya, hush puppies and the turkey sandwich with fries. Everything was flavorful and the waitstaff was very friendly! The fish was definitely my favorite!! Definitely coming back!!

Great oysters, fun environment, and good service.

I just don't understand why you'd wait in line - a line that extends into the street, even on a Monday at Four (4) PM  - and pay a serious premium to eat here when Felix's is right across the street.

Oh, that's right.  You wanted to be able to return home and tell everyone you went to a place that was featured on TV.  Nice.  TV was the shit in the 1980s.

A New Orleans institution. I actually didn't eat raw oysters here but had their fried peacemaker poboy. I can definitely see why it won 4th place best sandwhich, it was really good, I love the bread they use. 
Also the voodoo Mary was strong and delicious. Definitely make sure to order one!

We were in New Orleans for 5 days and I made a promise to myself that I would try as many of the oyster houses as possible while visiting. Acme did not disappoint! We were slightly concerned when reading all the reviews about the line being out the door. Quick tip for eating in New Orleans: if you don't want to wait Outside in line, go around 5:30,have a few beers and a appetizer....you won't wait long and still have a peaceful dinner without a ridiculous crowd. But back to acme, oysters were outstanding. Also had andouille sausage, red beans and rice. 
Service was fantastic ,wait staff was very prompt and courteous.....

We came here for oysters since we heard so many positive recommendations from people.  The line is insanely long but we came early so we got a table in 15-20 minutes of waiting in line.  We ordered soft shell crab platter ($17) and a dozen roasted oysters ($20).  The oyster dish was yummy.  Soft shell crab was decent.  Price is reasonable relative to french quarter prices.  Service was fast and efficient since this place is crazy busy.  Parking is horrible in french quarter so we took uber/lift to come down here.

Racism? My parents came for my graduation and I took them here today. And it is the worst experience these days. The waitress didn't ask us anything to drink before order, she just came and took away our menus without a word! I stopped her and told her what we want. Besides, there were 2 boiled crawfish on the receipt that we didn't order! I pointed this out and got a new receipt, there was no apology! And I noticed she ask a lady sitting at another table "how are you today and you want something to drink". So it is just because we are foreigners?

Possibly my favorite meal when I was in New Orleans. Cannot recommend the grilled oysters enough. Also don't be alarmed if there is a waiting line formed outside. It moves incredibly quick. We were seated within 15-20 minutes with a line going almost to the corner of the block

Don't be fooled by the line. It moves fast, you can drink a pitcher of beer in line in the street, and the service is almost instantaneous. We had raw oysters; chargrilled (extra yum!), boo fries and boom boom shrimp to share for four girls. Everything was awesome.

Blech. Won't be back. I've never had so many shells in my oysters ever. There was a piece of napkin in my corn and crab bisque. Won't be back with all of the other choices around. We wanted to order more food but I was worried at what might be in it. Had to ask for water three times. The server was nice, just super stretched with the busy night.

Everyone LOVES this place. But if I'm going to wait in line, the place better be really, really good. Luckily, I didn't have to wait in line! I had some special access which got us right in. For that, I'm thankful.

So, full disclosure: I don't eat wheat and finding options in the South was a bit difficult. It certainly was at this place. The food was good, but I wouldn't say it was amazing. The place is busy and the food kind of looks like it was prepared and plated in a hurry. 

So maybe check out the menu here carefully if you're on a restrictive diet. And maybe check this place out if you want to experience what the masses are experiencing.
Great oyster bar with a funky vibe! Highly recommend the oyster po boy and charbroiled oysters.

Admittedly, we only went to one Oyster House, so I am giving this 4 stars with no basis for comparison.  This is not a 4 star restaurant in NOLA, but it is a 4 star Oyster House in my opinion, or at the least, a 4 star Po Boy.  Call it 3.5 if you want, but I am rounding it up.

A negative about this place, as you'll read in many other reviews, is the lack of reservations and space, so you literally stand on line outside.  But don't fret, this is common (oyster house across the street does the same thing).  The line moves pretty quickly, though a lot of large parties come, which tends to slow up the works.  Anyway, there were maybe 8-10 tables in front of us, including a party of 10 or more, but we were seated within 30 minutes.

During that time, we got some kind of blueberry martini (you can't bring in outside drinks, but you can get drinks at the bar while waiting and bring them back outside to the line - you gotta love NOLA).  Those were delicious.  Highly recommended.

I'm not an oyster eater - my girlfriend is - but the purpose of this visit was to get a good po-boy.  She got a 1/2 shrimp 1/2 oyster and loved it.  I got a roast beef po boy.  Essentially, a roast beef sandwich made to look like a po boy.  Kind of made me wonder what makes a po boy a po boy.  Give me some au jus, and this would have been the perfect french dip sandwich.  Regardless, I don't care if this wasn't a po boy in the classic sense - this was an awesome sandwich.  Enjoyed every bite.

The inside is a bit crowded and loud, but its NOLA, so that's what you get.  We were sitting at the oyster bar, so not the most comfortable location, but the inside is lively and pleasant and you can definitely have a good time here and a good meal.  Worth checking out.
Overrated.  Tourist trap.  Long wait.  Po boy nothing to write home about.  Raw oyster was....well raw oyster-no wow factor.

I was never a huge fan of oysters until today.  Acme does it right.  The oysters are fresh, icy cold and huge.  Their grilled oysters are quite a treat.  A half dozen of each and a cup of crab-corn chowder was the perfect meal for me.  I was almost sorry i wasn't hungrier so i could try the Crawfish, the seafood gumbo,  or the Red beans and rice.

The service was ok... not the best, but i suspect the large party in the back and the late lunch but too early for the real dinner crowd timing had something to do with that. 

The quality was exceptional.  I would go back there in a heartbeat.

The line out the door might scare you away, but think about why this place has a line out the door. The food is delicious, and if you like oysters, then here is a place where you can eat to your heart's content and walk away with a wallet still as full as you.

I went here as soon as i woke up for their well known CHARGRILLED OYSTERS. I loved it so much i went back for another order for dinner.  If you're ever n New Orleans you should definitely try the oysters here.

Go during lunch. I walked right in at 11:30 and grabbed a seat at the bar. Half the tables were empty as well, but that was a temporary situation.

What will come as no surprise to anyone, I came for the oysters, and they were great. I had a dozen, raw and they were sweet and delicious. On the side, I had some Boo Fries (brown gravy and cheddar cheese-basically poutine, for my friends north of the border) and a Dixie beer. The service was friendly and the beer cold, so all in all, a really good experience.

*****************************************************
Update: Definitely go during lunch. I went back and walked right in again a few days after originally posting this. While it was crowded, there was no wait either time.

Nothing I can say that 1000+ other reviewers haven't already said! Best oysters I've ever had! Fried, chargrilled, raw, yum. 

Go for lunch to skip the lines..dinner lines can get insane. I also had the fried oyster poboy. Maybe it was an off day but the bread was kind of hard and stale..no matter because I just ate it without the bread.

Im pretty sure this is a tourist trap. Well, it is,because that's what the staff told me. The food is kinda expensive, but I do appreciate that they offer a new Orleans sampler, with rice and beans, sausage, your choice of chicken and sausage or seafood gumbo (the chicken and sausage is more flavorful) and jambalaya. 

The gumbo was served with a bit of rice in the inside and boy was it a flavor bomb. It is absolutely filled with sausage and chicken in every bite, the broth is salty and salty and spicy,almost like a beef stew on steroids.  It's hard for me to judge because new orleans cuisine is definitely one I am not familiar with. I can say that it is delicious though,and that I'm happy that they offered a sampler platter. The chicken was tender, and not overcooked like it often is in chicken soup, and the sausage was full of meety flavor, adding its distinct saltiness to the jumbo. 

Whoa, the Jambaya is salty. Like super salty. It has chopped chicken (which had toughened up into something resembling chunks of pork) and sausage (chopped into small pieces)  in it. And both are flavored strongly enough to stand out from the rice of the jumbo (which is what is super salty).

The beans and rice  are pretty good. Not the best baked beans Ive ever had. Theyre almost like slow cooked red beans in Mexican cooking. Except these are a bit softer, and are simmer with chopped up pork. A nice diversion from the salt heavy dishes. 
The sausage is actually my favorite. Its not super salty, sliced long side and grilled, giving it a nice char. It was meaty, not super salty, almost peppery. Definitely different from any sausage I've had before. Drier, but made up for it with the char, which I liked. 

The chargrilled oysters smelled delicious, but for $11.50 for half a dozen, Im going to go and see if I can find a place cheaper before I come back and splurge. Also, the only ingredients on the chargrilled oysters are according to the man at the bar: garlic butter and romano cheese

This is how you shuck an oyster. Stuck the knife into the hole where the tendon holding the shell is. Pressure that hole until it pops, then cut both the muscles (one on each side) holding the oyster in place. And its so much harder than it looks. 

 In the end, the food here is average. But your not really coming here for the food are you? your coming here to for the atmosphere, to watch the people at the bar shuck oysters. Thats the main attraction here

The oysters lived up to the hype! I split the dozen chargrilled oysters with a friend and we also order fried crawfish tails to share. Both were really great dishes and filled us up. The oysters are chargrilled with butter, garlic, and parmesan cheese, and they were so good! For dessert, go with the banana foster cheesecake - amazing!! We got here at 6pm on a Sunday with a party of 6 and we had to wait an hour to get in! I wouldn't skip out on this place because of the wait, I would just plan to go for a late lunch or early dinner instead.

We heard the reviews. 
We took note of the "extra long lines". 
We listened to our Tastebud Tours guide when he warned us against going during any sort of meal hour. ("Go to Felix's across the street" was his grandfatherly piece of advice.)
And yet my boyfriend and I were still hellbent on having Acme chargrilled oysters before our weekend trip ended.

Saturday was our day of battle. 
We decided to risk getting in line at 6:00 p.m. because our intended 4:30 p.m. time was just too ridiculous and we had other things we wanted to do. My boyfriend and I had just finished watching a three-minute Black Keys video on his phone when the hostess approached us.
"How many?"
"Two."
She did a double-take.
"Want to sit at the bar?" 
"Um...YEAH. Of course."
"Follow me."

So she led us past the line of hungry, envious people and into Acme, where the restaurant was occupied with tons of people, noise and neon lights galore. We were positively giddy with excitement when suddenly, our hostess stopped short and announced, "Wait. I lied. We actually have a table for you by the window."

And THAT was the start of one of the most memorable meals of my 2014 NOLA trip. I waited a total of three minutes to get into one of the most marketed restaurants in (probably) the nation out of pure luck. I've never been so happy to be in a party of two.

Believe the hype, you guys. Those chargrilled suckers are delicious - we ordered a dozen for each of us and they arrived at a reasonable amount of time with the garlic butter and Parmesan cheese still bubbling and popping. We also ordered the meat pies, which were good, but I think my boyfriend liked them more than I did. I wouldn't get them again. 

I was all about the oysters and I'm so happy that I got my fix!

Not a big oyster fan but I'm always willing to try. We ordered half a dozen raw oysters, a dozen chargrilled oysters, and fried crawfish. 

Raw oysters - not my thing, but it did taste good and fresh. 
Chargrilled oyster - delicious with the butter and cheese. Although two or three were a little too grilled and had the burnt taste. 
Fried crawfish - tasty of course

Even though it is super touristy, it's definitely a must-go if you're in town (and if you're into oysters).  There is a line, but it goes fast if you have a small party with no preference of where to be seated, we did not wait for more than 10 minutes.  Highly recommend the raw and charbroiled oysters!!  We also got a cup of gumbo and red beans and rice. The gumbo was good, but the red beans and rice were just okay.  The staff was friendly and nice, and it was cool seeing the guy shucking oysters behind the bar :)

O M G. This place is amazingggg!
I usually don't really eat shell fish or seafood in general because of allergy and personal preference, but I tried the sauce on the grilled oyster on a piece of bread and it's sooooo flavorful!

I ordered half po boy with fried fish (don't want to order chicken at a seafood restaurant lol) and it's delicioussss! On the side I've got hush puppy and it's pretty good as well! 

We shared a fries with their beef gravy and cheese - arg it's so good too!!!

Ok I guess the 4000+ reviews here have mostly justified why it's popular, but coz it's so good I still want to write a crappy review about it  just try it. You won't regret.
Usual long line, but there for a reason. Great food and oysters. Took family for first time and loved it! Next time we're in town, will drop by again. Great service!

Great oysters on the half shell! Draft beers are small but I was there for the food luckily. Place was packed but we were seated after a 10 minute wait. Wait staff was nice and the appetizers are interesting. We made a meal out of them and the raw oysters. Would come back again!

I really don't understand the appeal, we didn't get oysters so maybe thats why we don't think this place is all that.
We wouldn't have even gone here but options were low, it was around 3:30, we were hungry, and alot of restaurants were closed for shift change, or had a line out the door, so we settled.
The wait wasn't terrible, but we had to stand in front of a stinky alley way while we waited. The inside was dark, noisy and crowded. Staff was friendly enough, the hostess made me give her my drink I had brought in from another place I had been drinking while we stood in line.:P
We shared the Boo fries with roast beef gravy and cheese...nothing special, small serving of run of the mill fries with average tasting gravy and a sprinkle of cheddar cheese.
I got the fried catfish and shrimp with coleslaw and hushpuppies. There were bones in the catfish. The food was okay otherwise, I could've gotten the same where I live in Las Vegas.
The hubby got the Acme 10 napkin roast beef po boy. I think he only used 2 napkins. It was nothing special, more bread and gravy than meat. What a disappointment. 
We decided to stop eating and try a different restaurant in a few hours, I'm glad we did.

So many people suggested chargrilled oysters, I just had to give them a try. I was blown away! I like oysters, but I honestly don't know if I could ever have a raw oyster again without fantasizing these. The spices and garlic are invigorating as they're brought fresh off the grill. Get them! You won't be disappointed.

I also had their gumbo, which was delicious and modestly apportioned with seafood, which is all I was looking for this trip to NOLA. Not the best I've ever had, but up there.

The etouffé with fried crawfish was also delicious, but warm: like it had been sitting out a bit. A stark difference from the hot and fresh oysters and gumbo from before.

If you're going with 1-3 other people, prepare to share a table. Embrace it. It enhances the experience! Make friends. It's NOLA and the conversations are lively!

Really yummy char boiled oysters. I never liked raw oysters either but this was the first time I was able to actually enjoy them which would make this a five star rating! Wish they had actual garlic bread but other than that and the huge never ending line the place is great for food.

Acme is a good spot to venture to off Bourbon. The bar seating is nice as you watch the staff shuck oysters right in front of you. We enjoyed the laid back atmosphere of Acme and the friendly staff. 

The oysters were fresh and good. The sauce was nice and we enjoyed the raw plate with horse radish and hot sauce. The sides we had were good and the place is fairly priced. We ended with a plate of Voodoo Shrimp. It is a good sized helping of addictive gulf shrimp in a spicy honey glaze! Get these!

Acme Oyster House is THE TABERNACLE when it comes to oyster restaurants.  Especially in the French Quarter!!  As usual, there were people waiting outside for a table.  Since I was there by myself I was seated at the bar.  My main purpose for coming here was the Chargrilled oysters.  Despite the excess butter my tastebuds jumped for joy!!  The bread that comes with it can help soak up some the extra butter or you can eat it with an oyster which can be quite yummy.  The oysters can have bits of shell inside but takes time getting used to.  Service was great and so was the food!!  BELIEVE THE HYPE!!  Do Not leave NOLA without eating here!!

Love the fried crawfish tails!!! And the oysters. Can't go wrong with this old establishment. Don't expect luxury, it's a fried seafood joint. Good New Orleans cooking with a fun atmosphere. 

I always put the chipotle Tabasco hot sauce on my oysters. Best condiment for em and they always have bottles.

Easily the best Oysters I have ever had and worth the two hour wait in the rain. As my friend put it, the oysters are like getting punched in the face by the ocean! We also got the the po'boy and gumbo but we wished we had ordered more oysters instead.
Talk about fresh...the oysters are shucked right at the bar. There's always a line but it was totally worth it.

It's right off canal street in the western part of the French Quarter. Go there for seafood. I recommend going a little early because the line builds quickly.

What to order: Louisiana oysters are meaty and with a touch of sweetness. They're not the most delicate of oysters but definitely delicious. However, the shuckers will usually place the oyster in mud to facilitate shucking.

Tip: Use the fork provided unless you like your oysters extremely earthy.

When you are in New Orleans - French Quarter, you got to at least check out ACME once!  Acme is most well known for their char-grilled oysters. I would say this place hands down has to be the best place to get char-grilled oysters in New Orleans! It was so highly recommended by a few people that have been and they all let me know that I must try their char-grilled oysters. I must say in my everyday eating oysters are not one of my go to meals, but these were absolutely amazing. The garlic butter sauce they come with and the dipping bread for it is just the perfect combination. Highly recommend you check it out at least once when you are in NOLA! Took off a star because the long lines and seating can be a big pain, especially on the weekends.

chargrilled oysters.

Andrew C needsta name drop the place with better ones, cos those must be life-altering/

Love the convenience of the location since it's right down the street from my boyfriend's in Metairie.

Service is usually good and efficient. The oysters in my opinion are just as good as any oyster hotspot in NOLA. But if you want to go somewhere for a better price, but without location convenience, try The Blind Pelican on St. Charles. Cheaper during happy hour and just as fulfilling. 

I also have ordered the jambalaya which I think is phenomenal. I believe it has chicken & sausage - which is pretty simple but tastes like homemade jambalaya. I usually ask for shrimp on the side. Good combo. 

Everyone must love Acme because every time I'm here there's at LEAST a 10 minute waste. Luckily, their bar almost always has an open spot to either grab a beer or a bite for those with smaller groups, or in a hurry.

Don't let the line outside scare you, this place is worth the wait. The charbroiled oysters are right in the top 5 of the city. Large choice of po boys, the fried oyster po boy is the best. Glad I waited.
The two of us had the Soft shell crab platter with two soft shell crabs, fried crawfish tails, chargrilled oysters, and raw oysters. Excellent!!! First place we went when we landed in NO!
Always long line waiting outside, but good food tho... Especially good for tourists I think, you can enjoy typical New Orleans food here

Got to say this is where you get hooked to Oysters if you are a non-oyster person like myself & son.  The grilled oyster will be the solution to your dislike.  The other dishes we have tried from its sample plate was just not good and surely not memorable.  Otherwise this place is a need to visit just to get that stamp of been there done that.  After this.... really grilled oysters are everywhere in NOLA so you don't have to be here.

I would definitely recommend the chargrilled oysters as a must-do for any NOLA trip. This place has some amazing chargrilled oysters, but the other food was just average to me. I went in the evening for dinner and it was pretty crowded and busy so the service was a bit slow, which was understandable given the crowd.
The oyster is good and fresh, good busy virbe, but the food was a little overrated by yelp
We ate here a few days ago. The food was amazing. I got the 1/2 and 1/2 fish and shrimp po boy, it was great, give it a try

Hands down one of the best in town for some of the best southern food in town. 

Things to order:

Charbroiled oysters (buttery garlic seasoning with just the right amount of smokiness) slap yo mama good!! 

Seafood gumbo (creamy goodness)

Soft shell crab (crispy and light, not greasy)

Raw oysters (I don't eat raw, friends had them and said they're very fresh and juicy)

Service is excellent, waiter is very attentive and friendly.

We stood in the line with a five months old baby in a cold windy night for more than half hour and they didn't let me stand inside with the baby while my wife was standing in the line. This is how they operate!
In terms of oyster, fishermen's wharf in San Fran is far ahead, so disappointed in the food and much more in the inhuman behavior.

I had the Oyster & Shrimp PoBoy. I wish that I had stuck with oysters only. The shrimp didn't have much taste to me, but the oysters were delicious. I always believe that if you go to a pancake house...get the pancakes. I should have stuck with the oysters. Overall, I was very satisfied. The bread (poboy) was AWESOME! I could go here and have fried oysters everyday!
The oysters were so good they were all we ate for dinner. 3 dozen raw and 3 dozen char broiled for the 2 of us. We'll definately be going back on our next trip.

Had chargrilled oysters at Acme and Felix's. In my opinion Acme was by far the better place. Felix's left me with a an unpleasant grill taste that came up on me all day. Acme was OMG good! These two places are across the street from each other. 
Acme is the real deal if you want to experience this treat!

My wife and I tried this place based on all of the positive Yelp reviews and we loved it.

The chargrilled oysters were delicious. It was the first time I had ever had oysters and I would definitely have them again. I also got their oyster shooter which is a half shot of vodka with a raw oyster and the house sauce. That was also excellent! I was quite surprised. 

We split the fried seafood platter that had catfish, oysters, and shrimp as our entree. The fried oysters weren't nearly as tasty as the chargrilled oysters but the platter was good, nonetheless. 

The only negative was that we had to share a table with two other people. There were chairs between us but it was still kinda odd. 
All in all, I highly recommend this place to people visiting New Orleans.
The gumbo is decent but the oysters are killer. Kind of small inside, but most places don't have shuckers right in front of you, so it's understandable.
More hype than anything. Quality was fair and service could be better. Much better places in the quarter

We had a great time, sat at the bar, had fun talking to the oyster shucker and waitstaff, who were all really nice.  Got 2 dozen on the half shell and half a dozen butter garlic.  None of it sucked.  They do have to seriously dust the top of the mirror behind the bar though, we shouldn't be able to see the dust balls, it's a really tall mirror!

Yes yes yes, this is a tourist spot.  Yes, there will be a line.  Yes, there are other places where you can get oysters.  But, yes, I am recommending that you go.

We arrived in New Orleans on the Thursday before Halloween and were out walking around the French Quarter.  I was peckish, but not looking for a full meal so we decided on Acme.  We got in line and DH walked across the street to a bar and grabbed us two Bourbons-To-Go so we had sippers while waiting.  We did not have to wait long before we go to the front.  When the hostess offered us two seats at the bar in front of the oyster shucking station we were pumped!

If you can sit at the bar and watch them shuck the oysters I highly recommend it.  The shucker did double duty as our waiter.  We started with a dozen each of the raw oysters.  After those we ordered the chargrilled oysters that so many Yelpers have commented on.  OH MAN - these were delicious.  I will say, even though the oysters were great, what turned this from 3 stars to 4 was sitting and talking with the shuckers behind the bar.  They really made all the difference!

Go here, sit at the bar and eat some chargrilled oysters.  You will be happy you did.
It's ok. Not sure how the one sandwich is #4 sandwich in US. I've had better unranked sandwiches elsewhere.

As a local, I can say I also enjoy Acme from time to time. The chargrilled oysters are always delicious, and the poboys are pretty good too. On this occasion, I had the Acme special, with roast beef, ham, turkey, and cheese. I enjoyed it. My wife wanted a hamburger steak, which is on the Metairie menu, but not this one. She asked if they would make it and they were happy to do so. Others at the table had Boo fries and boom boom shrimp for appetizers, and they didn't leave any scraps behind. We dined with some out of town guests who enjoyed their Nola sampler plates. The bread pudding was also quite nice, though somewhat of a small portion.

Got in line around 5:00 and waited maybe 10 minutes!!! The food was great and the atmosphere was fun! Ordered the chargrilled oysters, hush puppies, seafood gumbo and oyster shooters... all was delicious and hit the spot!!! I would recommend.

We ordered the chargrilled oysters..... They were yummy!!! I ordered the New Orleans medley which was a decent amount of food. I wanted to sample a little of everything so it worked out perfect. My favorite item of the sampler is the jambalaya. My husband ordered a crawfish tail PO boy which was also good. Wait time was quick, service was good, and prices were reasonable! I'd go again!!!
All good. My surprising favorite; Char grilled oysters. Surprising because I'm not that big of an oyster fan. These were really great.

So over-rated! I guess people are eating here for the novelty of it?  If you want great oysters, skip the line and head across the street.  I just don't get it, but have friends who will not leave NOLA without eating here.

During our stay in NOLA, we only got to try Chargrilled Oysters at Acme Oyster House so I can't really compare it to anything else since I've never had Chargrilled Oysters before until now. 

This place is super packed and there is a line out the door as soon as it opens.  We arrived at 10:45am (this place opens at 11am) on a Saturday morning and there was already a line and we still had to wait.  We weren't really seated until closer to 11:15am.  Just to warn you know, it can be a bit chaotic when lining up.  They only seat you if your entire party is there.  Otherwise, you have to wait in line and they will skip you and seat other people who are there with their entire parties.  It can get crazy when there are huge groups of bachelor parties in front of you.  On top of that, there is no setup for a line.  There were some arguments that broke out and people were upset thinking that they were in line the whole time.  Just be ready for a mess! 

Once seated, they are pretty quick at taking your order and serving you.  We ordered the three dozen Chargrilled Oysters split between six people.  They come smoking hot to your table and bubbly with the melted cheese.  They can be very rich but they are definitely different and different meaning good.  

We also ordered three dozen raw oysters to split as well.  They serve Gulf Oysters which are thick and large.  I'm more used to the smaller varietals and felt that it was a bit too much for me.  I'm still a novice oyster eater but everyone else at the table loved them.  

We also got a soft shell crab platter and fried oyster platter.  By far, our favorite dish was the Fried Oysters.  Those were really really good.  Deep fried, juicy and tasty!  The soft shell crab platter was also another great dish with deep fried soft shell crab, not like the Japanese type of soft shell crab.  This was hearty and big and yummy! 

The gumbo and jambalaya were meh.  

Overall, we were in and out within an hour.  Is it worth the wait?  I'd have to say YES if you haven't tried Chargrilled Oysters.  But it's really more worth the wait for their other dishes which are just as good.
Never a disappointment. Mouth watering Chargrilled Oysters are out of this world! Always friendly service. It's nice to see the prep station for the oysters too.

First tried Acme Oyster House at the Harrah's casino and had the grilled oysters. Absolutely DELICIOUS! From the oysters to the bread to dip with. I definitely had to try the restaurant after that, and another order of grilled oysters. There's almost always a line in front but it is certainly worth it. I ordered the traditional Cajun dish, seafood Etoufee, the flavor was great. Only down side was the quality of the shrimp, very tiny, and it could've used a little more rice for the gumbo style dish. Make sure not to overload on oysters and etoufee because the bread pudding with vanilla ice cream is AMAZING! Craving some now writing this review!

We were lucky to land there at a time when it wasn't super busy and only had to wait a little while. Sat at the bar and would recommend that to everyone. Shockers make the experience! Bo fries were my daughters favorite along with chargrilled oysters and gumbo. Our favorite dinner while in Nola!

I was able to visit Acme for the first time this past weekend while i was in New Orleans celebrating Mardi Gras!  Of course you can't go to NOLA and not eat, drink, and be merry and Acme was definitely a great part of this experience.

After waltzing around enjoying the parades, drinking, and having a dang good time....evening came and we wanted real food.  Acme came up as an idea.  They had me at seafood.  Of course there were tons of people in town so there was a line of about 30 feet worth of people to get in.  Ironically, even though we waited an hour outside to get in, the line moved pretty swiftly for the amount of people that were in it. 

The decor of the restaurant was about what i expected for it to be a restaurant in the French Quarter. Nothing to rave about but not a dive by any means.  I don't think people would've cared either way because they were here for one reason just like me....the food! 

We ordered fried crawfish tails and "Boo Fries" for appetizers.  Two great choices.  I was a little hesitant on the "Boo Fries" simply because it seemed like an odd combination to me.  My friend swore by them though so here we are! The waitress bring them out and there lies this huge plate of fries topped with roast beef gravy and cheese. I'll just say that i'm glad i trusted my friend!  Never lead me wrong...the streak continues.  Get the Boo Fries if you come here!  The Crawfish tails were delicious also and will be a definite choice each time i come here.

I ordered the Fried Fish Platter as my main course.  I was amazed at how much food they give you.  The fish filets are two huge pieces.  There are a tons of fries and I got 4 hushpuppies as my side.  EVerything was delicious.  The hushpuppies were heaven.  Im not usually a fan of bready sides but they must put unicorn tears in these hush puppies b/c they are delightful to the taste.  

If you're in NOLA....visit ACME!
Charbroiled oysters were delish..gave dragos a run for their money! Nice staff..must check out if you are in the quarters!

5 stars for the oysters, but the other food was little to be desired.

The charboiled oysters and the fresh ones were great! Definitely get a mix of both, because they are so different from one another. The charboiled are creamy, rich & buttery. We used the bread on the side to sop up all of the goodness. The fresh oysters were oceany and not at ALL fishy. They just tasted like the best part of the sea in a bite with a bit of lemon.

The Étouffée was SUPER duper DUPER salty. Maybe we just had a bad batch? Or maybe it was just at the bottom of the pot? Goodness, we could barely eat it. We ended up using it as a dip for the fried crawfish on the side. Even then the fried crawish were just okay. Next time I'll just stick with the oysters.
Love the raw oysters.  The seafood gumbo is the best one we had so far.  Seafood étouffée was a little salty for me.  There is a line to get in, but well worth it.

So here it is, my humble opinion. Had oysters here and at Filix's across the street. Both are excellent. Here is the difference: Filix's oysters are gently topped with a bread crumbs and gently grilled. At Acme they are hevily topped with cheese and really heavily grilled. Pick the style you like. Truly you can't go wrong at rather place.

The line was down the street! So, I was excited to see what the hype was all about. Well, the waiter was a BITCH her attitude was was horrible!! The food was average. We had to share a table with other people whom we didn't know. Which was kind of uncomfortable. I won't come back!
Great food. Steve was our waiter. We watched him shuck oysters serve us drinks and food.

I fully understand all the-freakin' hype!!  The Char-Grilled Oysters are a MUST!

Everything we tried here was very tasty, but only the oysters warrant the wait in line.  DO NOT get off line or else consider yourself warned that your visit to New Orleans would have been in vain otherwise.  Seriously.  From my previous visit to The Big Easy, I would have said that Cafe du Monde is the only MUST for their beignets, but I would never ever discuss New Orleans restaurants with anyone I consider a friend and not mention the oysters at Acme, too!  These lil suckers are TASTY!!  Hot, Zesty, Buttery, Garlicky, Cheesy Perfection!!  Make sure you have enough bread to enjoy every bit of the oysters & sauce with...sinfully good, but you will be forgiven.  3 of us shared one full order and seriously considered ordering another round until our entrees showed up soon after.

For dinner I ordered the 1/2 & 1/2- half fried fish and half fried shrimp.  Yummy, especially if you try their cocktail sauce, loaded with horseradish!  I loved it!  Thanks goodness for all the kick in the cocktail sauce cause the red beans & rice that I ordered were actually a bit on the bland side.  Perhaps an "off night" cause I didn't think such a thing could exist in Nola!?!  Anyhow, it was still good!  As were the hush puppies and the bite of my friend's bread pudding!  

We had to thank the chef manning the oysters on the grill on our way out - it was just THAT good!

I went here for lunch while on vacation.  I was skeptical because I anticipated it to be yet another overpriced tourist trap in the french quarter.  I was pleasantly surprised.  I got the fried shrimp poboy which was infinitely better than the poboy I had from Mothers.  Much more flavorful and they definitely did not skimp on the shrimp.  My sandwich was overflowing and I had lots to eat afterwards.  The service was kind of awful though and out waitress left us alone for long periods.  She gave us the bill and then didn't come back for almost 10 minutes.  It really only takes 10 seconds for me to put a debit card onto a plastic tray.  But nothing horrible happened and the food was good, though of course it had the typical NO markup.  My boyfriend ordered raw oysters and said they were some of the best he has had.

Rarely  do I believe the hype and stand in line for an but I stand amazed at the Acme Oyster House.  I have only eaten oysters one time- and hey were raw and in San Francisco. Only cocktail sauce came with them and I was underwhelmed. But after hearing about the chargrilled ones here- I had to try.  So we were seated at a table with two other couples.  They had three dozen of them and offered us a taste. OMG- flavor bomb of garlic, butter, Parmesan and smoke. Tender and tasting of clean ocean, 12 were just not enough for he three of us. Still- we curbed our desire so we would have room for our main course. Must also mention that 5$ a glass Chardonnay was reasonable. 
     We got the shrimp platter and the fried shrimp was fresh, hot, crispy and delicious. Only downside was no sauce available other than ketchup. Ugh! I got the Boo fries which were a take on poutine and the gravy was out of this world. 
      Our final choice was the hamburger PoBoy medium rare plus cheese which was a good burger. 
      Our server was awesome and had waited 4 years to get hired there because no one ever leaves. You ABSOLUTELY have to try this place at least for the chargrilled oysters. I will for sure be back in my next trip to NOLA.

I came here after a college graduation looking for a good place for lunch, and I realized quickly this place is liked by many.  Started with very long line to get in.  Once I got in, 30 minutes later, the taste of the food was enough of an explanation as to why this place is popular.  I think their Grilled oysters are a drug because they are too good to be real.  Well seasoned and grilled just right.  Also the oyster cutters are friendly and sociable.

I love this place, I always have to go when I first get in town and on my last day. I always get a full dozen of the Charbroiled oysters. They are the best French Quarters. I have tried the crab claws, and you do get a lot for the price however they don't have any flavor.

If you like fried seafood, this is the place to go. If you're able to, I would suggest seating at the bar. The men that were shucking the oysters also serve as your waiters. They are very entertaining and full of stories to tell. I think the most noise came from our section at the bar because we couldn't stop laughing from all the jokes they were telling us. Also, say hi "Hollywood". He's been there for over 25 years, and he's really proud of being there.

If you're looking for good chargrilled oysters, this is the place to go! They're served sizzling hot and that just adds to the deliciousness of the oysters. We sat at the bar and the bartender, Curtis, told us not to order a half dozen because if we did, we would regret it. I'm glad we listened because they were so good a half dozen wouldn't suffice. He also told us to pair it with the Tabasco Chipotle, one of the three Tabasco sauces they offered. It added the right amount of kick and flavor to the already delightful oysters. Whatever sauce is served with the oysters pairs well with the bread they serve with the oysters. 

Next up, I tried the crawfish. They weren't that great but you also don't hear people telling you to go hear for this. The crawfish were huge but the flavor wasn't that great and there wasn't much juice in the head. I wouldn't order this here unless you desperately want crawfish like I did. 

The sides... for the sides I ordered red beans and rice and jambalaya. They were good but nothing to brag about. 

The wait... the wait is something serious during dinner time. Don't let this deter you. Experience the goodness of the oysters. This restaurant is small like many others in the area. 

Overall, come here if you want some great chargrilled oysters in a fun atmosphere. There are TVs here just in case you want to watch the game with seafood and brews.

Everything about this spot is right on. Best chargrilled oysters we had. Also tried the shrimp po-boy and the seafood gumbo. Just excellent. There's usually a line out front, but it moves fast and the food is worth the wait.

The line was long it took us about 45 mins to get seated but it was by far worth the wait in line! 

Michael our Shucker/ Server was great had worked for Acme for 35 years!!!! The oysters were delicious!! Service fast with happy faces all around!!! 

Definitely hit this spot if you're in for a good meal in NOLA

Everything was phenomenal! The jambalaya was the best I've tasted in Nola. The red beans and rice were delicious. We also ordered the chargrilled oysters which were great and the seafood gumbo with crawfish which was also good. I would highly recommend this place. We went on a Friday night. The line was long but we got in in less than a half hour. It's definitely worth it!! A must try spot!

There are too many selections for places to eat in New Orleans. 

While staying around corner at Marriott ,  I tried Yelp, OH MY GOODNESS so many selections, so many good review, so many so close and only one night to eat. 

Stepped out side the hotel and the aroma waffling around from all kitchens. Oh my goodness. 

So While working up in Hattiesburg, MS. A customer recommended this place. He was spot on and I had remembered reading about it on Yelp. It was AWSOME. 

It is hole in the wall literally. Pretty basic, I walk to the place and see a line that seems like a mile and  a half long at 9:30pm. As I walk past,  I notice 2 seats at bar open. I go to walk In and a customer says you better get permission before sitting down. The Guy behind counter is shucking oysters, with out missing a beat says get permission from hostess, I look around I can't tell hostess from customers. Plus I am 6' 3" tall looking right Over her  lol. 

I had the grilled oysters delicious.grilled crab claws and étouffée it was AWSOME the atmosphere is quaint. Staff polite and quick. Food was delicious defiantly a go to place. 

A note to the drunks out there. If you walk in to an establishment that serves alcohol and you can't find the bar, you probably have had to much to drink! Just saying.

We love this place!  The shrimp po boy and a cold beer will get you where you need to be.  My wife is crazy about the oysters whether they be grilled, fried, or raw!  We highly recommend it one of our favorite New Orleans restaurants!

Overall, Acme was really good! Not the best I've ever had, but pretty good. We tried to come here before, but the line scared us off, like many others. But later we decided to wait and when the line starts to move, it really moves! We waited about 30 minutes. 
All I ordered was a bowl of seafood gumbo. It was great! It had a good flavor and a good amount of shrimp. Some places really skimp on the seafood they actually put into the gumbo, but not Acme. 
The service was ok. It was really busy so the waitress seemed a little flustered, but she was very nice!
I'd definitely recommend Acme to anyone visiting NOLA!

Good oysters. BBQ shrimp is delicious. Crazy long line. Good wick service but incredibly busy. It's nice to try once to say that you have but not sure the line is worth it if you are hungry and want to eat within the hour.

This place was really good. The line gets long so you may want to get there early. 

We had the boo fries for an appetizer, these are regular fries covered in beef gravy and cheese...AMAZING!
We also got a pound of charbroiled oysters these were delicious too. 

I had a cup of the oyster Rockefeller soup, there was only one oyster in it so the soup seemed like a warm spinach and cheese dip to me, but it had good flavor. 
I also had the smocked sausage Poboy, I asked for no tomato but they put it on there anyway. And I wish I had gotten a 1/2 sandwich so I could have gotten a side. 

Overall everything a good flavor.
i love oysters! if you want to enjoy the fresh, salty taste of this delicacy, acme is the place to get them!
Great service and the food was amazing. There was a line when we arrived but it moved pretty quickly.
Waited about 40 minutes for a table for two on a Saturday night, but totally worth it. The chargrilled oysters were TO DIE FOR as were the fried crab claws. Very highly recommended!

Visit- 3/1/17
This is the place to check out when in NOLA!!!!

Line was out the door. I thought it would be an hour long wait by looking at the line. Talked to the organized host and he said he could seat 2 (keep in mind we were willing to eat at the bar or table) within 8-10mins.  I told him I called him bluff.  Sure enough we were sitting within 8mins. 

We were seated at the bar in front of our server/chef. It was entertaining to see him work his magic. He could interact while cracking and preparing the oysters.  

We decided to try their flavorful, buttery, parmesan chard fired oysters, gumbo and oyster shooters.  Whether you had an oyster shooter before or not, you have to try Acme's. Highly recommend joining the club ;-P

It appears to be a hole in the wall, but it's worth the wait and the price for the great company, service and food. 
This is a must go to place!

I don't know why there are reviews of this place where there is so much hate sometimes but all I can say is this placed SAVED my rear last time after a long workday schedule ! 

NOTE: If you have a fellow diner who has a SHELLFISH ALLERGY, this IS the place to go! Especially if you love seafood yourself! They have an AMAZING roast beef Po-boy here and the BOO FRIES are INCREDIBLE. Boo Fries by the way are an appetizer of fresh cut fries covered in cheese and roast beef gravy and the dish could be a total meal. 

The raw oysters on the half shell are a bit pricey but they are FRESH and HUGE! The same goes for the Po-Boy sandwiches as the portions here are generous. If you are willing to eat at the bar you can eat quicker here and they will make anything you want custom to order if it is not on the menu. I wanted a plate of some fried oysters ONLY and they made that for me too.  

They also carry the latest seasonal version of any ABITA beer and the kegs are fresh and the taps are clean! (You can taste the difference too!). For the those unfamiliar with Abita Beers, you really can't go wrong on any of them. AndyGator goes great with seafood and the next time they make Mardi Gras Bock I am considering a commando style raid on the brewery to steal all of the kegs. :-) 

Oh yeah..one more thing that is a biggie: The place is CLEAN! The staff busts their ass and they get your food to you FAST! Don't let a long line outside scare you away because it moves pretty fast. At least it did the night I was there. 

NOTE: These are GOOD people that operate this place who do their best to make sure everything is awesome. Don't act like a pushy, jackass tourist here. You ain't in NYC! This ain't the Bronx and you don't have to start an argument just because you wanted something extra. Just ask politely and you will have it. It's called "Southern Hospitality" and IF you have the grace and breeding to see it, your "cup shall runneth over".  If ya still don't get it then keep moving past here and go drink some" hand grenades" with the college punks to raise your IQ.

Based on Yelp reviews and the fact that I wanted fried oysters we waited in a short line at Acme today for lunch.  Unfortunately we were both disappointed. My oysters were small and the breading was dark - a little over cooked.  My husband's crab cake was just average.

Great food and great service. Had the Charbroiled Oysters and Chicken & Andouille Gumbo. Ordered an extra order of the Charbroiled Oysters they were so good. Would recommend this place for anyone in the area.

4.5 would probably be a more fitting rating. Char-grilled oysters are the way to go, honestly don't even get the regular ones. The grilled ones were definitely top 5 in terms of things I ate in NOLA on my trip.

This place is the prime example of a tourist trap. There is NOTHING special about it. From the long wait (45 minutes on a weekday), dirty atmosphere, mediocre customer service and probably the most whatever food I've eaten in all of New Orleans. If you want good char oysters go to dragos. This place was such a disappointment. Will never go back, nor recommend.

Long Line mediocre food everything seems to be fried. I was eating my half dozen oysters on a half shell when a cockroach crawled over my foot then scurried back underneath the door into the dish washing area. The whole place is sort of dirty around the edges. We tried to take a picture of the roach but apparently they run when the flash from the camera hits them. I had the soft shell crab platter it was lackluster surrounded by lukewarm fries.

Had the shrimp po boy sandwich with sweet potato fries. The French bread was soft and made the sandwich a must have. Most patrons were ordering the oysters which looked and smelled really good. I'm planning to go back to try the oysters.
Good was good, drinks were awesome.  Only downfall was a 35 minute wait.  But well worth it!
I was on a hunt for crawfish. Found them but not as good as the ones from Cajun seafood on the other side of town. Three stars for the service. Our waitress was a sweetheart

I am wondering if those who are giving it high marks eat crap on a daily basis? Seriously, the worst food experience EVER. Out of the four things I ordered I only finished the oysters. Everything else, a few bites to confirm my disgust. I will agree that the char-grilled oysters are good, but your talking about butter, garlic and lots of cheese...of course its good. It was the only meal that my friends and I had where we sat around in silence. It is the last time I would ever go to this place if back in New Orleans. I definitely would not recommend it to anyone; short or long wait. Luckily we only waited about 15 minutes for a table. Oh and my favorite part was when a random server asked if we needed anything else. We said no we were done and please take away the items from our very crowded table with full plates. He went to tell our server and she looked at our table, rolled her eyes and continued to walk back and forth without lifting a finger just to move at least one or two plates so that we had some space to even sign the check. She did pick up the empty plates from the table next to us as if to say FU to us. P*ta. And yea we still tipped her 20% because it's not her fault the food sucks and her fake smiles were good enough. Besides, karma...

We tried going here on our first night but the line was too long. We decided to try again the next day and arrived earlier but still waited in line. But it was so worth it. I'm not an oyster fan so I ordered a shrimp po-boy.  My friends ordered the chat-grilled oysters. After I tried one, I had to order another dozen! I would go back to New Orleans for these char grilled oysters. I Must find some in Houston. I'm addicted.
Amazing service and food. I couldn't believe how good the fire grilled oysters were. I had a Po Boy and it was to die for. My girlfriends and I loved it here!!!

These are some of the best charbroiled oysters I have had. PERIOD. My first time here (years and year ago) is the reason for my love of oysters. 

There is this pool of garlicky butter that the oysters are swimming in. Dip the bread in this juicy goodness. Heck, order extra bread and try to get every last drop of those tasty morsels.

There tends to be a bit of a wait. Just go for it. It is totally worth it. This is definitely a place you need to hit up if you are a tourist.

Had dinner here last night.  Luckily our friends were waiting in line and we were seated promptly.  We had oysters raw and chargrilled which were good.  My husband had the roast beef poorboy and really enjoyed it.  I had the shrimp etouffee  which was good as well but a little on the salty side.  Restaurant was super busy.  Not sure if i would queue in line for the food here, probably would go across the street to felix's if the wait was too long and get an equally if not better meal.

I always have to eat at Acme Oyster House when I'm in New Orleans. Its one of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans. The wait is long, but WORTH IT. I love the jambalaya and grilled chicken po-boy. Acme never owes me anything.

The hurricanes are horrible.  Like, really really, really bad.

The oysters are amazing.  Come here for these.  The oyster Shucker if you are nice to him, will let you take your photo with him.  (i'm not sure why we thought this such a novelty, perhaps it was caused by the hurricanes)

come here for your oysters - go to Pat O'Briens for the hurricanes

Boo fries, sweet potato fries and a seafood platter. YES indeed! The service is always tops and the margaritas are pretty good too. I usually go to the place on Vets but every now and then you've gotta be a tourist in your own city and enjoy the quarter. If I remember right they have a live cam that rolls on nola.com.
The chargrilled oysters are the only good thing on the menu however they're the best oysters in New Orleans.
OMG!!! This place was sooooooooo good! I love the oysters and the crawfish étouffée. I will eat here every day of my life if I could.
Loved loved loved. Packed and worth the wait. Gumbo oysters etc.  ball awesome.   Great place great good.

The raw oysters were good.  The service was good even though busy.  You do have to wait for your food.  The waiter was awesome.  He was super accommodating and courteous.  This is a must go.  Ate the Acme 10 napkin roast beef.  Definitely need extra napkins.  The roast beef was flavorful.  Worth going to and worth the wait in line.  Was about 30 minutes but went by fast.
Oh my gosh, so good! Our family was only half joking when we considered roadtripping down to New Orleans again just for their char grilled oysters.

French Quarter landmark, a must do. Food is good, could be better. Their menu has a variety of selections to choose. This place has earned its name for their Charboiled oysters but to be honest I've had better. It's still worth the go though. Had their crab and corn bisque, Taste of New Orleans sampler. And oh that  pecan cobbler for dessert, wow that was great.

This place is one of the best places we went to eat while visiting New Orleans. I had been recommended to come here by a friend and after checking other reviews we decided to try it out.We went pretty late for dinner, around 9 or so and there was a bit of a line but we were on vacation and didn't mind the short wait. Once we were seated our waitress greeted us right away and got our drinks. When we were ready to order we asked our waitress what she suggested and let me tell you she did not steer us wrong. We started with the deep fried oysters, we ordered a dozen and honestly we could have eaten 2 dozen. They were delicious! We then got our dinner entrees, my son got the soft shell crab with a side of hush puppies, my daughter had the seafood gumbo, my husband had kind of platter with red beans and rice, gumbo and sausage and some other tasty things. I had the shrimp  creole which was fantastic.  We all tried each other's food. I honestly can't say who's was the best, they were all really really good. We ate way too much but it was so good it was hard to stop. All in all the service was friendly and efficient and food was all I hoped it would be.
The chargrilled oysters are delicious! We waited in line and were not disappointed. My friends and I loved them so much that we went back again the following day!

Had to try this place out. Ok lines are long I recommend coming during the week, was not that bad So I got the Jambalaya( love this) , two roast beef PO boys , hush puppies and steamers. 
THe roast beef was so tender like butter and the Au  Ju they use is amazing Everything was delicious and fresh. Probably one of the best places to get your Cajun on !

Now for the review...

Service: (4) Our waitress was very friendly, helpful and always smiling.

Food: (3) Chargrilled oysters were good. Shrimp platter (saucer) was very good, but a bit salty.  The "10 napkin po-boy" was okay.  You 
don' t even come close to needing 10 napkins..one will due because they are now that small. 

Portion size: (2) See below.

We have been to this Acme location in the Quarter several times.  The last time was two years ago. Not happy with them this time as the portion size is HALF what it once was, but more expensive!  The bread pudding was the size of a small ice cream scoop. What's going on here?

NOTE TO MANAGEMENT...It's not cool to rip off your customers. See, we have the power to go elsewhere. I certainly will.

Would give a 2.5 overall, but will round to 3.

I can not come to Nola without coming here! Highly recommend the chargrilled oysters!! I've had the boo fries and the medley in the past as well. I loved the corn and crab bisque we tried this time. I'm a big fan of purple haze beer. Finish things off with a pecan cobbler sundae it will not disappoint!
