One of the best places to go for oysters in New Orleans.  Very plump and juicy, you can easily eat a dozen or two.   Be prepared for a line/ wait during peak times (lunch and dinner).  But it is definitely worth the wait!

I don't presume to be so special as to have the ability to add some here-to-fore unmentioned revelatory nugget of wisdom (that the previous 1869 reviewers may have omitted).  But what I will say is that for a high volume, kind of touristy oriented establishment, the staff is extremely friendly and efficient, and doesn't have that kind of "I've seen it all and heard it all so shut the F up, Mr. and Mrs. Tourist" attitude, like the staff of so many of these type of places seem to adopt.
I'll  add that the oysters-char broiled, raw, and Po Boy-are all out of this world.  And don't forget to try the pecan cobbler dessert, because if you do, you are depriving yourself of great pleasure.

Expect to wait! That's one of the most important parts. We waited in line for an hour on a Sunday evening. There is no rhyme or reason to the wait and you are provided with zero explanation as to why it how long the wait will be. Once we were seated, Alisha was our waitress. She was great. She was friendly and fast. She was wonderful with pleasantries and made us feel welcome. Our food was excellent. There are zero complaints there, with the exception of some of the oysters. We had the charbroiled oysters, raw oysters, seafood etouffee, shrimp po'boy, and fried soft shell crab. Some of the oysters had a ton of shell with them and were really dirty, which always makes us for a bad eating experience. The rest of the food was really good though. The cocktails left something to be desired, but they did the trick!
We loved everything about this place. From the raw oysters to the PO boys which was the last meal I wanted to have before leaving to go see RollTide play. Service was great and the food was perfect!

I'm not an oyster person, but I wanted to try new things since I was in NOLA. The char-broiled oysters were absolutely mouthwatering, my entrées were delicious, and the pecan pie dessert was so good that I don't even have words to describe it.

This is definitely not a quiet place. Bad after a hangover.

I went with a bunch of guys from a non-profit that I worked with. The big boss came into town and bought us all dinner.
The wait was somewhat long for me. I'm not the type to wait for anything. However, it wasn't up to me. We needed 2 tables, so perhaps that was the problem.
I guess it was speedy for 2 tables (sit at the bar!!!).

The waiting staff was great! It was packed and they still managed to be super attentive.

Anything that was fried we ordered. Fat. Yummy.

We ordered tons of oysters on the half shell. The cocktail sauce is great and definitely necessary. Definitely what I needed.

We wanted to go to Felix's across the street, but the lines were even longer and the bill would've been much larger, so we stuck with Acme. Good thing we did.

Great for singles, couples or groups.

But like I said...lots of hustle and bustle and noise galore. What do you expect, though?

I wandered into the Acme Oyster House today and am very happy I did! 
I sat at the oyster bar where Steve, one of the shuckers, took excellent care of me. I had the chargrilled oysters followed by Steve's recommendation for seafood etouffee with added crawfish tails.
Damn, that was a delicious meal!

I highly recommend this place and appreciate the friendly staff.

Acme has never disappointed me. On any given trip to NOLA I visit at least once, usually more than once. Be ready for a line, there's always a line. My staple is the raw oysters. I've also gotten them chargrilled...they're good but not my fav. The combo of gumbo, jambalaya and red beans & rice is a nice compliment to the oysters and makes for a perfect NOLA meal.

There's a line outside this place for a reason. The charbroiled oysters were insanely good, I've never had anything quite like them. Only giving them a 4/5 because it's really loud on the inside and you can feel like you're eating on-top of other diners

Chargrilled oysters...AMAZING!!!

The best bloody mary and the most amazing grilled oysters, EVER.  Loved the fried oysters, catfish and SS crab.  Waitress just "got" it and totally anticipated our needs.  Totally worth the wait!!!

Chargrilled Oysters, where have you been my whole life?? I think I love you... WOW, just wow.  I never liked cooked oysters before, but decided to give it a try because my friends raved about it.  I initially planned to order just half a dozen of the chargrilled oysters and half a dozen of raw oysters.  However, my friend convinced me that I can have raw oysters anywhere, but chargrilled oysters were a specialty of Acme.  Glad I followed her advice!

First of all, when the waiters delivered the chargrilled oysters to the table, I was fascinated to see that the oysters are still sizzling, such a beautiful sight to behold :)  I was worried that the oysters would be too buttery and cheesy that they would lose their brininess.  Even though it was true that oysters lost their "oyster-ness", i.e. the brininess, the satiny texture and the taste of sea, it didn't matter because that butter sauce was amazingggggg.  I was slurping down these babies at a superhuman speed, and can totally understand how someone can eat 14 dozens of them in one sitting (according to Acme's wall of fame).  I was sharing a dozen with my guy and we finished within 5 minutes.  We looked at each other, and wordlessly decided that we need another dozen. I also have to mention the bread, it was the perfect delivery system for that delicious butter sauce.  Words cannot describe how happy I was eating them.

We also tried the New Orleans Medley and a side of potato salad.  Both were good, but paled in comparison to those oysters.  I really wanted to come back and get two more dozens of oysters before we left NOLA, unfortunately we ran out of time.  This is a definite stop if you are in NOLA, my friends who weren't big fans of oysters became a convert when they tried the chargrilled oysters.  If they open one in NY, I will be the first in line!

Our dinner here was the least spectacular meal we had in New Orleans in our 4 days here. There is a long line for this place around dinner, but it does move at a decent pace. However, I didn't think the food was worth the wait. Granted, we got the gumbo jambalaya, and étouffée (and not the oysters). The portions were less than impressive given the price. The gumbo was a bit too salty and the jambalaya could've used more seasoning. I did however enjoy the seafood étouffée.
the grilled oysters were the best meal i have had this week in new orleans. oyster shooters $1.50. it's a slam dunk!

DISAPPOINTMENT would be an understatement for the experience I had there. I've already had char grilled oysters at two other restaurants before coming here, the oysters are decent but definitely didn't stand out from the pack. And that's where the good stuff ended.

I was extremely looking forward to its Seafood Etouffe and what I was served was no where near what I expected. The so called "seasoned seafood" turned out to be a handful of small frozen shrimp available at most grocery stores. And the gravy tasted just like normal gravy one would have for breakfast biscuit or even mashed potatoes... 

Then the jambalaya. We only ordered a side size and the thing came already looking kinda unfresh. The first scoop confirmed it. Not only did the jambalaya tasted mushy but it was cold! We told a staff and he said he was going to get us a hotter one. Ha turns out they just microwaved it for maybe like 1 min or something. Doesn't change the fact that it was awful jambayala. 

We also ordered onion ring because my girlfriend came here two years ago and was very impressed with their onion ring. Well to say the least the breading tasted very dry and it felt like those onion rings were fried a long time ago and were just left out there.. 

We were so dissatisfied and eventually the manager came. I mean one would probably expect a manager of a well known restaurant in the area to be really serious about these complaints about the food quality. But this manager straight up told me that he would take those off of my check and simply left... I was left in shock. Seriously it felt like he didn't give a damn about what I have to say about their food and was sending the message that "it's cool if you don't like it, we have a line waiting outside anyway" I don't know how a restaurant that doesn't take customer complaint about food quality seriously can keep being successful... 

I'll just leave it here - there are absolutely better options for seafood around the area if that's what you are coming to NOLA for. Acme DOES NOT live up to its popularity and 4 star review on Yelp imo.

I loved this place ! They were extremely friendly , very New Orleans ! And knowledgeable about everything !! Oysters were great and the food had a lot of flavor ! They continued to seat people even after closing hours . Will be back

I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars. Wow was the food amazing! The portions were really large too which is perfect for a foodie like me. I got the fish and hush puppies and I have to say, I've never tasted anything better.

We ate here on a recent trip. I ordered the Chargrilled oysters, which actually ended up being the best I found during my short trip. Staff were quick, friendly. Wait was fast for us since we were not in a group. Would recommend going in a small group to avoid waiting.

I'm very excited to write this review, I've been here several times and it never fails me.  The most recent experience was M'm! M'm! Good!  I had the charbroiled oysters and the catfish platter and both were amazing.  You know it's good when you are dancing in your seat.  I can't believe all the times I've been to New Orleans I've never had the charbroiled oysters!!  If you like oysters DO NOT miss out on a great thing, they are wonderful! They come with some bread to dip in the juice they are literally finger licking good.  Catfish was fried to perfection and the hushpuppies were delicious, not everyone can make great hushpuppies, but these babies were yummy!

I am from NOLA, and I took some out of town guests here for lunch before they left to return home. We all enjoyed our meals, very much. We got chargrilled oysters, boom boom shrimp and boo fries as appetizers. The oysters and shrimp are especially delicious. For meals we got: jambalaya, gumbo, sampler plate, hot sausage poboy,  acme special poboy and a hamburger without the bun, add mushrooms, onions and gravy to make a hamburger steak. We then got bread pudding for dessert. Everything was delicious, and there was no speck of food left on anyone's plate :) The bread pudding is good, but comes in tiny cups. The service was decent as well. I would certainly recommend this location!

There was a line getting into Acme Oyster House like it was a club. The hostess was super nice and pleasant. She made the wait easier.

So, Acme Oyster House has a 15 dozen raw oyster challenge and initially, I got sick of the thought of 15 dozen oysters.. It's too many, I thought. And after I went, I got tough like I coulda woulda shoulda. I wished I had tried. If you don't finish it in the allotted time, you pay. If you do, you get your name on the wall and that 15 dozen is free.

If the challenge interests you at all--- DO IT!

Now in the restaurant, there's table seating or the oyster bar.. With a long line outside, you get what's available and we got a table. Our server pointed out a few things on the menu and that they're famous for their Chargrilled Oysters. Yeah, the Chargrilled Oysters are sooooo fantastic. Boo Fries and Bread Pudding with Ice Cream are also recommendable..

Worth the wait.

The charbroiled oysters were fantastic, the medley dish was delicious (with rice and beans, jambalaya, and gumbo.  The soft-shell crab po-boy was good, but the oysters stole the show.  There's always a line out the door, but then once you walk in there are lots of tables open.  I wonder if that's their way of pacing the kitchen, or a ploy to make them look like they're incredibly popular?

Right around the corner of Bourbon St., Acme Oyster House is in a prime location.  They don't take reservations, so there's a line to get in during peak eating hours (it gets very long, so get there early).  

I wanted to try a selection of what they have to offer, so I got a half dozen of the chargrilled oysters and a meal combo that included half a shrimp po'boy and a side of jambalaya.  I'm not a big fan of oysters, but you can't go wrong when they're chargrilled and covered with butter and cheese, I almost wished I got the full dozen.  The combo meal was also great, the po'boy was delicious with warm, flakey bread, but the jambalaya stole the show.  As much as I enjoyed my meal, I kind of regretted not getting the jambalaya as my full entree.  The side portion comes in a small cup, but still manages to pack in a nice portion of chicken and andouille sausage mixed in with super soft, slightly spicy rice.

Overall, I had an excellent meal at Acme Oyster House, but they do fall prey to much of the same issues I've had at other restaurants in the area.  As a tourist from the Northeast, I'm not used to such a lack of healthy options on a menu, but that seems to be the standard anywhere near Bourbon St.  Acme really does an amazing job of cooking up many NOLA standards, just do not come here expecting even a slightly healthy meal.

My better half and I ate lunch here today. She had the fried shrimp PoBoy and I had the peace maker PoBoy. Both were very good. We also had the fried crab fingers for the appetizer along with the charbroiled oysters. Both were very good as well. She even commented how the charbroiled oysters were good. (She's never had oysters before but was willing to try them here.) 
Will definitely eat here again. Service was extremely good thanks to our waitress, Maria. She was very pleasant and knowledgeable.

May take a while to be seated as the line is long and they do not take reservations. The service is excellent but the seating tends to be a little crammed/ crowded. If you have the ability, you'll be more comfortable visiting their Metairie location.

During my 5-day stay in NOLA, I was lucky enough to stay in the quarter and I went to Acme almost everyday.

For its price, Acme worths every penny. $10 for a dozen of freshly shucked oyster is pretty decent. But don't pay extra for the baked ones, they are not as good.

I never walked out of Acme paying more than $20

Avoid the long lines, remember to get there early, before 5pm, get some oysters, local "amber" beer (i forgot the name), then walk around Bourbon St and go somewhere for your real dinner.

If you are expecting a nice and fancy oyster bar where you can order oysters by their names, Acme is not for you.

P.S. I think Acme is way better than Felix.

Wait is a lot faster than anticipated, go at night after 9 and the wait is not too bad. We got a table for two in under 30 minutes. 

I am not sure if it was the build up, or seeing the enormous line, which made me believe the food here would be amazing. Or if it was the name of the famous Acme, but this wasn't what I had expected. Fries weren't crispy, the baked clams were good (besides few with contained sand), and the drinks were good.
The food is great and the food is GREAT. It's a must stop shop in new orleans. Get your oysters and po boy!
We live this place; it was one of my girlfriend & i first date'' great food , reasonable price & a crazy long line that attempts to intimidate you don't let it work saying it is well worth the wait

"Grilled Oysters", you think you've had them but unless you've been here you haven't.  They are unlike any place I've been.  

I'd give the place 5 stars but they have no vinegar and the waitresses I've experienced are not very detailed oriented (i.e. water and napkins).  I get it, it is a volume shop, no frills so don't get high expectations.  All the staff however are very welcoming.

Cold beer, grilled oysters and slaw.. awesomeness.

We had a great experience! There was a line of only about 4 groups when we got there at about 1pm on a Friday. So we only waited about 10-15 minutes. The service inside was fast and friendly. 

We got the fries with gravy and charbroiled oysters as apps to share. Both were divine. Then I got a soft shell crab po-boy. It was to be expected, kind of a standard po-boy with good flavor but nothing different than you would expect. The cocktails were great - the blue blood martini was a real treat.

This was definitely one of the best meals we had in NOLA.

BEST seafood place in New Orleans!!! Worth the wait. Line is usually long but moves fast only waited 15 mins for 2. The chargrilled oysters were AMAZING! Definitely start your order with at least 2 dozen you won't be disappointed

Awesome place! Great food...great service! Loved our waitress, Anndrea. She was amazing. Had oysters both raw & char-grilled. And the roast beef po'boy was excellent. Also had the Oysters Rockefeller soup...it was good but a bit rich. The fried crawfish tails with remoulade were yummy. For dessert, we had Barq's root beer float and took a slice of bananas foster cheesecake back to our hotel room. Can't wait to go back to this place.

Really good but pricey. The charbroiled oysters are phenomenal. Acme grilled them with parmesean cheese, butter and garlic. They come with plenty of fresh bread to sop up the goodness. My entree was the fried soft-shell crab. It was fried to perfection; light, not greasy and very flavorful. The dish is accompanied with a very horseradish heavy cocktail sauce. That was a big plus for me. Be prepared to wait as the lines tend to be long most of the time.
The best poboy I had in our trip to NOLA, nicely fried, generous portions of shrimp and oysters.    The gumbo was average.  The lines can be long but was ok for lunch as we got there early.

Attention all first time visitors to New Orleans.  This place is a must. For expertly shucked gulf oysters in an authentic environment this is the spot.  Tasty, friendly, quick and affordable to boot come for a quick dozen and leave happy.

Long wait because it's so popular, but worth it! Food was delicious! I ordered the fried seafood platter, my girlfriend had the fried shrimp po boy and we also had the boom boom shrimp appetizer.  Come with a big appetite because they give you very LARGE portions of food! My meal came with two full fried fish fillets which I was not expecting, along with a pile of fried shrimp and fried oysters.  My girlfriend could have made a whole other sandwich with the shrimp that was left over from eating her fried shrimp po boy.  When they say the boom boom shrimp appetizer is a "generous portion" of sweet and spicy fried shrimp, what they mean is it's basically a meal on its own.  In conclusion, food was delicious and a must if you find yourself around Bourbon St in New Orleans.

Me and my family ate here this past Monday. We ordered half of a dozen of Oysters raw and Half of a dozen chargrilled, Cajun fries with chili and cheese, sea food platter, and soft shell crab. We waited in line for a really really really long time because we heard this place was rated one of the best in New Orleans. I gotta be honest, maybe it's just not my taste or I have different opinion but there wasn't anything special about this place not one bit. Lol it was Not worth sweat standing in line nor the stinch from the garbage alley you have to stand in front of. This was my first time and I'll say probably my last time. I can assure you I had better seafood during my stay in New Orleans. The flavor of the fish, shrimp, crab was nothing to rave about. My strawberry margarita was just okay. Y'all sweat it out in that line. I actually think the waiting in line for hours is purposely done for marketing so people flock like sheep to come in to see what everyone is waiting in line for. Just my opinion.

This place is so small. That you have to sit and share a table with other strangers. The excessive long wait line outside not worth it to me. We came on a Thursday got lucky there was no line. Looks like a lot of items on the menu is oyster and that's what they are known for. Not my type of food. Food came out fairly quick. Service was mediocre.

At least the batch of food I had was a lot of hype. Oysters were kinda small. Felt they were sitting there for a while. Wouldn't say they were much better than the frozen ones we get at a Chinese buffet restaurant in NY. Gumbo was salty and uninspiring. The only upside was a delicious local beer Abita Topdog. Steve the oyster shucker was nice.
Long wait in line, but worth it!  The charbroiled oysters are great.  The rice, beans and sausage were also awesome.  Hole in the wall but good food!
Still as amazing as always. The charbroiled oysters topped with cheese were amazing as were the fried shrimp, seafood gumbo, bloody marys, and hushpuppies!
One of the best restaurants in town. Jambalaya and chargrilled oysters are must have.

The oysters here are wonderful!! I had them raw, chargrilled and on the Po boy.

The fresh and chargrilled were amazing!!!!!! Some of the best I've had.

The Po boy was only okay....the bread is what makes it so bad. The insides were great (friend oysters and shrimp) but there was so much bread and it was chewy and rubbery. 

Also got shrimp étouffée which was only okay.

If you go here, just go for the oysters!

I am a huge OYSTER fanatic.  Coming here was definitely not a regret !!  I ordered about 3 dozens of oysters- 1 dozen of charbroiled, 2 dozen of raw.  The oysters weren't too big nor too small.  Perfect size & tasted delicious.  I would HIGHLY recommend for the oysters

I have been here several times and consistently had a good experience.  While all the food I have had here over the years has been good.  This time I am talking about the chargrilled oysters.  I have eaten them all over town and this place has the best ones.  I eat them every day when I am in New Orleans.  If you haven't had them, get down here and get some!

I'm not going to say anything different from most reviews here.  The char-broiled oysters are fantastic.  I had the half shrimp and oyster po-boy with tabasco infused mayo, fantastic.  My GF had the roast beef po-boy and red beans and rice, she was a big fan.  Bread pudding for dessert, awesome.  It had a hot caramel sauce on top. Damn good.

We found this on Yelp while in town for one night.  Thanks Yelp.
Damn their oysters are THAT good. People aren't too friendly (don't blame them, place is packed EVERY. SINGLE.TIME.) But the chargrilled oysters make up for all of it and even more

I was never really the type of person to eat seafood in shells until I went to New Orleans. I'd had mussels before, and they were fine, but definitely not a preferred option.

Then I went to Acme. I had the grilled oysters, and everything changed. Listen, I went in skeptical and apprehensive, but these were super flavorful, and the grilling really is a nice touch. Plus, they're pretty filling, which is something I didn't realize initially.

Now I will say that the restaurant was a bit more congested (for the space it had) than I might have preferred. If I was going back, I'd probably try to avoid regular meal times.
Best chargrilled oysters!!! We didn't wait for a table, we just sat at the bar. Worth it though!!!

This place is amazing. I went with some of my co workers one night. Place was packed but luckily we found a table for 6. We got the raw and charbroiled oysters. The charbroiled oysters were beyond delicious. I have had raw oysters many times but never charbroiled. They were very good. I also got the fried shrimp and my co workers got other entrees such as the gumbo, Po boys, red beans and rice. Everyone left with a clean plate. The bread pudding I got for dessert was good too. Overall a great place to eat.

Affordable prices and great food and service!  We got there around 11:30am and it was easy to find a seat but as we left around noon, there was a line out the door!  We got the boiled crawfish which was about $10 a pound that day and it was delicious and fun to eat!

Yum! So happy that my friends and I decided to make a stop here on our recent trip to NOLA.  The wait to get in took about an hour, but it was worth it.  Plus it was a Saturday night so there were a lot of entertaining things happening on the street.  Also, to keep the time moving we went inside and grabbed a drink at the bar to drink while waiting in line (I wish all cities allowed this).

When we finally made it inside we ordered fresh oysters and baked oysters for the table, and my friend and I shared the popcorn shrimp.  Someone else in my group ordered fish and chips which looked pretty tasty.

Overall, it was some pretty tasty seafood,  it what I loved the most was the vibe of the place.  There is just so much energy in the restaurant as well as right outside the door.  I would highly recommend visiting this place if you find yourself in New Orleans.

This was a total disappointment and completely overrated. The Po-Boy's were dry and didn't have enough dressings. The chargrilled oysters were horrible....you want good oysters you should go to Oceana those are beyond words!! Acme was a nightmare!

Pretty much any time of the day, you're gonna see a long line coming out of this place. If you want a table, expect a long wait. But if you're a solo traveler or just with one other person, just sit at the bar and you'll get seated right away without having to wait at all. I did see a brief window where there was no one in line (though the entire restaurant looked packed) around 4pm, so if you're down for eating a really late lunch or really early dinner, maybe that's the time to go.

While most people come here to try the oysters, I actually came here because I was told they have some amazing po boys here. I tried the soft shell crab po boy, which comes with a side of fries. Despite the large and awkward shape of the crab pieces, it's actually not hard to hold all of it into a sandwich, and tastes really great when dressed.

Service could be better at the door. They seem to be kinda rude to the people who are waiting in line because tourists always look for ways to just walk in and take a seat. Service inside is really fast and really nice though. Refills are free for non-alcoholic drinks, and I noticed that the bartender always got refills ready for customers as soon as they looked like they were about to finish their current glass.

If I'm ever in NOLA again I'll definitely come by again to try the oysters.
The best oysters i have ever had... Chargrilled was my fave... The fried was great to... & my bf loved the raw ones! Must try while strolling down bourbon st!

The Char grilled Oysters were Amazing!!! I was first in line some con artist tried to cut line but other than that a great experience if you come to New Orleans!!! The cocktails were also good I liked the hurricane here it was stronger than another place I went to!! The bread pudding was delicious!!! The wait staff was very friendly overall I enjoyed the experience!!!

Ok, so I wanted to see what this long line around the building was worth waiting in the heat.  There it was, Acme Oyster Bar! Of course, I had the famous char-broiled oysters...well worth the wait. The gumbo was great! And, the the Hot Sausage Patty Poboy was a delight with fixings on French Bread.
It's a small casual store-front but clean on the inside. Rhonda was attentive ensuring we had all we needed to enjoy our experience. She talked New Orleans which I had grown fund during my stay.

Yes, the line is long.

Yes, it's hot outside in New Orleans.

Yes, Acme Oyster House is amazing.  Best fried seafood and char-grilled oysters on the planet.  Fried catfish is amazing and lightly breaded in what I believe is cornmeal.  Everything is just a little-bit spicy, which I love.  Drinks were great (drink the beers here, as the Hurricanes at Pat O'Brien's are a lot better).  Wait staff is in a hurry, but they always get the order right and make great suggestions (which is crucial if you're a Yankee like me who's uneducated in the ways of NOLA cuisine).  

This place is authentic down to it's foundation.  I love coming here whenever I'm lucky enough to get down to New Orleans.  Wait on line, don't complain.  If you feel like you're going to complain, grab a hand-grenade at Tropical Isle (make sure it's in a plastic container) and enjoy the day.

we strategically planned our eating adventure to hit this place when it first opened its doors (the websites say it opens at 11am but we strolled in well before that... 10am maybe?)  yep.  oysters for breakfast... we've done worse.

we decided to order:
- chargrilled oysters (full dozen) $19.99.  this comes with a side.  we chose gumbo.  the gumbo was good but we liked the jambalaya more.

- side of jambalaya $3.99 - great, great jambalaya.  bold flavor and not soggy.  we were fans.

the oysters.  no, we didn't do the raw ones.  just because we felt like we could get raw oysters anywhere.  (you probably disagree)  what we did want to try were the chargrilled oysters.  we wanted to know what the hype was all about!

they come out hot. as in you should wait a sec before diving in.  they are pretty special.  i have no idea what makes them so delicious... there is no description on their menu!  the only thing i can offer is that there is lots of butter, white wine and cheese.

FOOD:  delicious!  there is a reason why this place has been around for 100 years... their gem-chargrilled oysters.

SERVICE:  quick.  wouldn't say we received the best service but they are trying to churn people outta here so it is understandable.

AMBIENCE:  this place is a lot bigger than i anticipated.  picnic-like looking tables. casual setting with an oyster bar.  we would have loved to be seated at the oyster bar but were unable to secure seats during either visit.

OVERALL:  we loved our meal here. i would recommend coming early in the morning to try this place.  otherwise, you will be dealing with long lines that never seem to die down... even at 2 in the morning.

We had attempted several times during our stay to get into ACME, but each time there was a line about a block long.

Finally on our last night, we knew there was no other choice than to stay in that line.

It was worth it!  Crawfish and the Jambalaya alone was worth the 40 minute or so wait!  The Charbroiled Oysters would have been worth waiting even longer! 

Do not be discouraged by the long lines,  view as a testament to how good this place really is!

I'm not an seafood person. But, I wasn't going to New Orleans and not tried seafood. So, I know of this place from the Travel channel best places to chow down. I got the charbroiled oysters, which our waiter recommended. Pretty darn good. For my main course I had the gumbo. The portion was a little small but tasty. Then for some reason I did an oyster shot. It was like someone blew their nose in my vodka. All in all it was a great experience.

Great restaurant for the middle of tourist central. I think Acme is more famous but our meal tonight was excellent and we really enjoyed it. Had char grilled oysters that were excellent, crab fingers were very good and believe it or not, I ordered a cup of red beans and rice to snack on and they were awesome.  All reasonably priced for a tourist area restaurant. Only issue is it is SMOKING hot in the side of the restaurant we were in. I guess they have a new grill and the AC is not balanced yet. Otherwise, a frat mela overall. The heat is he only reason they don't get a five star. Very uncomfortable.
Incredible food and friendly waitstaff. The oysters are phenomenal. I had it once, and craved it all through out the trip. It's a must to check-out!

Oysters are a must when you visit NOLA. You can go practically anywhere but Acme has to be experienced at least once. Is it busy and should you just expect to wait? Yes. Should you expect delicious food? Absolutely. 

Grab a dozen iced and chargrilled oysters and a Purple Haze beer. You won't be sorry. The oysters are huge and meaty, not as sweet as we are used to back on the West coast but they were buttery and fresh. We sat at the bar, which to me is always the prime spot. You're elbow to elbow with the next guy but you get a show and get to start up interesting conversations with the staff.

Delicious. All I got was the chargrilled oysters and that was plenty. Although I wish I got the full dozen instead of the wimpy 1/2 dozen! I also heard the boo fries were very good too! I went on a Thursday night and the wait was about 30 minutes. But I was alone (work trip) and was seated at the bar in 2 minutes. It is a very touristy spot near Bourbon Street, but hey I am a tourist and looking for great food!

Chargrilled oysters were so delicious!! Don't miss the bananas foster cheesecake!! Great ambiance and very tasty alcoholic drinks that I've never seen elsewhere. Our waiter was very sweet and gave us great recommendations! We will return here again...maybe even this trip!

Come on people we are all smarter than this. Tourists, you can do it. I have faith in you all .The line is not worth it and you can easily walk to find better. Throw a rock and go inside whichever building it hits. Eat there.

Been here twice- throughly enjoyed it both times. There is almost always a wait to get in, and busy weekends in the quarter will test your patience- it's worth it though. My favorite is the jambalaya pasta- perfection for those of us who do not care for seafood.

Great food and good service. The door girl was a bit of a dick but we didn't have to eat her.  The food was great. Adam Richman killed 15 dozen oysters here then killed the toilet.  Place is loud but has a great energy. I got a bit nauseous during my meal when I saw a Manning jersey on the wall.  It made me have bubble gut. I had the New Orleans medley. It was good enough to to kill in five minutes. Off to drink ..... Tell mom I love her.

My first time eating oysters- the chargrilled oysters were delicious!! The wait wasn't too bad and the food came pretty quickly. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I had to sit at the end of the bar right next to a trash can that they kept dumping the plates and food into, that was kinda gross but the oysters and our waiter were very good!

Acme was my first meal in New Orleans and one worth remembering.  When I arrived in the city, it was pouring rain.  I am from Phoenix so heavy rain is a rare and exotic site.  Acme did not have any tables available so we sat at the rawbar, which I would recommend.  We had our orders taken promptly.  The oysters are chucked right in front at the rawbar and sent in bar for frying.  The ice tea that I ordered actually tasted like tea (unlike most establishments in the middle of the country that taste like brown water).  The tea was so good you actually taste the vitamins!

The meal arrived in about 15 minutes.  I ordered the oyster and fresh fish plate.  It was lightly battered with a butter and milk fried coating.  Delicious.  The fish was fresh and could not have tasted better.  It came with cole slaw and hush puppies.  The meal was sizable and I was hungry - an ideal situation.

I even ventured to have the bread pudding.  Do not miss desert here and come hungry!

We had an oyster shooter each, raw oysters and charred oysters...to start! We really enjoy this place. Sometimes you have to wait for a table but it's worth it. The staff try and be quick. The seafood platters were all great.

Chargrilled oysters were soooooooo delicious! They were still sizzling when they got to our table, and I wish I had some to eat now... drool. However, the etouffee left a lot to be desired.  It's supposed to have crawfish, but came with shrimp instead (our waiter did warn us, but we ordered it because he still suggested it over the sampler).  It wasn't nearly as flavorful as my bf and I like, just tiny shrimp in a brown sauce that looked and smelled like etouffee.  Moral of the story: stick to what made Acme famous... oysters, and lots of them!

The Charbroiled oysters are the same level as the Drago's, but the atmosphere of this place in the quarter should be something every tourist and native should experience. Not only are the oysters an attraction, just about every single New Orleans favorite can be found here.
Oyster shooter was better than I expected. Chargrilled oysters are a must. Seafood etoufee was yum! And the gumbo was also good. I'd definitely visit again.

This place serves delicious sea food. If you come to New Orleans you should try their gumbo and of course oyster as an appetizer.
Our server was very kind and funny, we had a great time.

This was a fine experience for New Orleans tourists, although some of the locals we met said the place is overrated. We came for an early lunch. The crowd was light, so we were seated right away. The waiter came professionally and quickly, as did our food order. We had grilled oysters, gumbo, shrimp po'boy sandwiches, peach cobbler, and bread pudding. The sandwich had an average taste, and the cobbler was bland; everything else tasted fine. Nothing was amazing, but nothing was terrible. We might comeback for the oysters after we try a few of Acme's competitors.

Would not recommend this place at all! Not sure what everyone sees but the long line outside makes you think this is a place to be reckon with but the service is way below average, so is the food therefore will not be back.

You know, a lot of people, specifically locals, give this place a lot of flack for being a tourist trap. And maybe it is, a little bit. However, I've been to Acme probably two dozen times in my life, and I can't say that I've ever had a bad meal. Have I ever had an OUTSTANDING meal there? Probably now. But that's ok, it is what it is. Fried seafood po' boys, red beans and rice, and of course, oysters. Their raw selection has always been good, their po' boys pretty standard, and their chargrilled not too far off from Drago's. So, don't let the snooty locals fool you. If you want an introduction to po' boys and oysters, it's ok if you go to acme.

This place is packed all the time. It takes longer if you have a group. We had seafood food gumbo, Rockefeller oyster soup, and chargrilled oysters. The oyster soup was a bit salty but the chargrilled oysters are delicious.

It's not a place for kids. They play loud music and people talk very loud. We feel like we are yelling to hear each other. Overall, it's a good place to try oysters.

Husband had the char broiled oysters thought they were delicious five stars, finally found some really great Cole slaw too!! I had the soft shell crab and fries, crab really good but fries average so four stars and the service was great at the bar but the cleanliness of the restaurant three stars, hope that helps:)

The chargrilled oysters at the Acme Oyster House goes on the list for, one of the last meals I would have to like before I die. 
The chargrilled oysters are dressed with lemon butter and a whole lot of parmesean cheese. 
My partner who rarely eats seafood ordered the roast beef po'boy and he was HAPPY! 
I can't wait to visit NOLA in the future just to eat here!

The charbroiled oysters are huge and taste great. This place gets really hyped up though, so sometimes the line stretches down the block to get in. The oysters are good, but not "wait in line for an hour" good. If you have the option, just try back when there isn't a line.

Always a line to get in. We went yesterday around 3:00pm. Had approx a 10 min wait. Not too bad. Their specialty is char grilled oysters with a sprinkle of cheese on top. My order was so overdone and dry that I should have returned them. My wife's and sister's were much moister. It was my first time having oysters this way so I thought this was normal. After eating them and commenting to my company, they both said their's were moist and delicious.  Oh well, I didn't know any better. Maybe the waiter should have spotted how charred the shells were and send them back for a redo. 

I ordered fried oyster platter for entree and it was good. Can't condemn the restaurant for one mis step. It happens.
Their hush puppies were delicious as well as their cole slaw. 
Good over all experience, but they are not worthy of the constant line.
Good service and great food. The chargrilled oysters were fantastic.
Awesome prices and YUMMY food! Service was a little slow.. But totally understandable bc it was BUSY. Can't wait to come back!

Stopped in for early dinner on a Thursday afternoon. No wait for a table. Smaller inside than I thought but I loved the ambiance and the lighting. Our server was very friendly and provided many recommendations. My husband ordered the poyboy and fried and I had the Charbroiled Oysters so we could share. The sandwich and fries were very average but the oysters were amazing. I'm typically not an oyster fan but I couldn't stop eating. A must do when traveling to NOLA. We would stop here again.
Had to try Acme after all the good things I've heard from the locals. Very good food and nice atmosphere. Definitely a good selection when looking for a good meal.

we waited about 20 minutes to get in. very over hyped. The food was so/so. It not real worth the wait. Food portions were small for the price and the po boys bread was ok! You are better of going to felixs across the street.

Upon approaching the Acme Oyster House, my husband and I were met with a line at the door. Just great. After about 15 minutes of waiting, we were led to a communal style table with a checkered tablecloth and sat in the middle of two couples. When the food came out and I took my first bite, I instantly forgot everything else!!! I had the gumbo and a half shrimp po-boy. I wanted to lick the bowl!!! Everything was good down to my drink!! Folks, the food is worth that wait in line. I promise!!

Chargrilled Oysters are a MUST. If you're unsure, get 6. Then kick yourself because you didn't get 12. We also had the 1/2 and 1/2 shrimp and fried oysters, the fried oysters were just as good as the chargrilled. The fried shrimp were also good.
Delicious! This was my first trip to NOLA and this was exactly what I was looking for in terms of local type food! The service was great and it was very inexpensive! Recommend it!
I really do feel that Acme is overly rated, I feel their food is okay but it's not the best seafood that I have Had...

The most amazing charbroiled oysters!!! The line moved pretty fast. It's very noisy inside with shared tables. The service is not fast but the servers are all very friendly. I would go back daily for those oysters ! Oh and the cold slaw and red beans and rice with sausage are very tasty as well

Last stop on our N'Awlins trip back in July and i can still crave the chargrilled oysters that make Acme so different from other places by having this special oyster available. 
I would go back to New Orleans only for that.

Lines are constant here and it's just because the oysters are so fresh and yummy. Raw, chargrilled or other-- this is the place to go!

i'll be un-vegetarian for oysters. ;)

This place was on my list of places to visit in New Orleans, and ended up being my husband's and my favorite place to eat.

We made the mistake of not getting there before the lunch rush, and ended up waiting about 45 minutes in line. We typically don't bother waiting in lines, but this was actually worth the wait! When we put down our names, we chose to sit at either a table or the bar, and ended up getting seated at the bar (otherwise we would've had to wait even longer to eat!)

My husband and I ordered half a dozen Raw Oysters, half a dozen Chargrilled Oysters, and the Fried Seafood Platter with soft shell crab. Both types of oysters were good--the raw oysters were fresh, and the chargrilled oysters were so delicious! The seafood platter was delicious too, and came with a lot of food. We were both really full after eating everything, and couldn't finish the fries and hush puppies.

Despite how crowded and busy it was, the service was great. The staff was friendly, and the woman working at the bar was quick and attentive.

This was our favorite place out of all the restaurants we ate at. I wish I could go back for more oysters and crab!

A must-stop in the French Quarter.

The line will be out the door, but grab a Sazerac in a to-go cup from 21st Amendment across the street and wait.  You won't be disappointed.

The grilled oysters are the real deal.  Sit at the bar and meet new friends while you watch the experts shuck and tell great stories.
I've never been a fan, but these oysters have converted me.

If you are hungry, want chargrilled oysters or just some New Orleans food full of their favorite (butter) this is your place. Friendly fun, inexpensive, huge portions, but there can be lines. Great family place and very casual. Yes it is a chain but it is good eats.

Came here after Reading all these fabulous yelp reviews.  Beware!  Don't let the long line fool you.  The food is not special.  We tried the fried oysters which were small and dominated by the breading.  The fried shrimp were also small.  The red beans and rice was average.  The gumbo was very good but don't eat the mealy shrimp.  There is nothing they do that warrants the wait.

You have to try this place at least once when you're down here. Not fancy, no reservations, and inexpensive; just a quick bite to eat for lunch/dinner. 
Everything we ate was super good! I had the crawfish poboy and he had the soft shell crab! The spicy Bloody Mary sure had a kick! Don't forgot to try the hush puppies: it's a type of fried corn nugget (sweet and crunchy)

I would come again most definitely.

My wife had the crawfish Etouffe and could not have been happier with her meal.  I had the half gumbo and half crawfish po boy and loved every bite.  Not quite as good as Mothers, but nothing to be ashamed of either.

Will be visiting again on our next visit to NOLA

The constant line out the door, is a sign that this place is legit! While Acme Oysters is a bit of a tourist spot off of Bourbon Street, the restaurant does Oysters right. The food is fresh (chargrilled oysters were amazing), service was good, and you are just seconds from Bourbon Street activities. 

This place does get busy, and they do try to move you along. It can get tight and may not be the best spot if you are looking to take your time and talk with friends/family. Grab seats at the bar when you can.

Fun atmosphere with great service. The chargrilled oysters were great. We ordered the oyster po' boy, seafood étouffée, fried shrimp platter and dessert. Other than the chargrilled oysters most of the food was just ok. Loved the hush puppies. The atmosphere made it worth it.

This is hands down the best restaurant in New Orleans. The char grilled oysters were amazing for an appetizer. For the entree, the shrimp po boy and jambalaya are a must! The food came out fast, and the service was great!

Ordered three dishes: Seafood Etouffe plus Fried Craw Fish, half a dozen of the Chargrilled Oysters and Raw Oysters. 

The Chargrilled was delicious and i can see how it made this place popular.  Raw Oysters were just ok and not served on the ice. Felix's is defenitely better deal with the same price. The Etouffe sauce is great but the shrimp was not fresh. 

No water offered from the server. Not sure if staying in line will be worth it.
Charbroiled oysters were the best.  We were lucky the line was short.  Get there early

we had the char grilled oysters and they were good. the new Orleans sampler with sausage, red beans and rice, jambalaya, and gumbo on the other hand were not. the sausage was dryer than california's water drought, the red beans and rice were simply wallpaper paste, the jambalaya was fresh out of the good old freezer, and the the gumbo was nothing to talk about. for entrees we had the fish and oysters where again the fish was cold and oysters were very small. the "hush puppies" were simply sweetened deep fried cornbread. steer clear unless what you're going for is long john silvers drive through quality.

The place always, always has a wait.  Which is pretty typical for all of the "must-try" touristy spots in NOLA.  That being said, this place truly is a must try.  If you are from anywhere but New Orleans you will not have chargrilled oysters like them make them here.  This is a very no frills type of place.  It's loud, it's filled with tourists, the chairs feel like they're about to break underneath you, but again, it's all worth it.  I wouldn't get anything but the chargrilled oysters, because everything else that I've tried here is mediocre at best, but the oysters are PHENOMENAL!
I wasn't impressed. The service was really slow. The food was decent, but I wouldn't wait more than 10 minutes to eat there. Go across the street to Felix's.

A friend insisted we go here because it was apparently amazing 30 years ago when she last was in New Orleans. It may have been so back then but now it is is horrible.
They don't take reservations (most don't-no problem), but by the enormous line outside you would think it was the bomb. Oh, it "bombs" alright!
After waiting 30 minutes in line, we waited 45 for our food in an environment which I would call unsanitary. Probably a good thing most dishes are deep fried and would kill any potential pathogen!
The food was at best mediocre. This is a raw bar and fried food-in-a-basket kind of place. The fried crawfish and shrimp (po boy) were not great quality. The etouffee was the worst we had all week. It was like a thin brown beef gravy with tiny frozen shrimp from a bag. (Chef: etouffee is supposed to be a thick flavorful stew, btw). 
Waste of time and money. There are too many good restaurants in NOLA to waste time here.
If you want this type of menu, Remoulade on Bourbon was orders of magnitude better in quality, taste and cleanliness.

The food is consistently good here. I hadn't been to Acme in about 5 years and it is still as tasty. 
The line is ridiculous but doesn't turn people off so that should tell you something. 
I had some shells in my oysters and that's a big NO NO! Still were the best oysters I've ever tasted! 
This is a place you must visit on your trip to NOLA.

A popular tourist spot, and the wait line extends out the door for most of the time they are open.  And why?  Fresh, tasty seafood!  While not the best place for a po-boy, the variety is great, and the softshell crab poboy is not something you can find at most French Quarter establishments.  The charbroiled oysters (which are all the rage these days...get on the bandwagon now!) are out of this world - full of butter, parmensan cheese, and heavenly goodness.  ACME is a MUST-stop eat.  The history of the place, the electricity of all the people, and getting to watch them shuck your oysters are reason enough to join in the fun.
I didn't know that mankind had achieved deliciousness such as this. Horrible wait and fend for yourself service pretty much sums it up here in the French quarter though.

It was a little bit of a wait (20 minutes) on the sidewalk, but the food was very yummy! We had chargrilled oysters, which were delicious, and I ordered the seafood etouffee, which was buttery and tasty. We washed it down with ice cold Abita Amber beer, which was just what I needed.

Yet another place that doesn't need another review by little ole me, but good god, I am still dreaming of those chargrilled oysters. Holy crap. Wow, yes, I think I just salivated.

The raw oysters (I gotta use the crackers--no shooters for me) were tasty. And, you know what? Those crawpuppies are like a bite of heaven. Crawfish and hushpuppies together? In one delicious bite? Or two if you bite 'em in half.  Um, okay!!

The stuffed crab thing was my least favorite, but we ordered it toward the end, so I was mostly already full from the other bites. 

Washed it all down with an Abita Wheat and left fat and happy.

First stop in NOLA did not disappoint. The gumbo was great but the fried oyster po boy was absolutely out of this world. Get a whole because you aren't going to want to stop eating on it! Bread pudding was great too... maybe you can't go wrong?

Wasn't what we expected, all tables were family style meaning if your looking for a party of 2 on a Weekend your going to wait a VERY long time. Our waiter was rude and gave us the look of "You Cheap SOB's" when we ordered 2 orders of oysters, he wasnt a happy camper. 

They oysters are good but everything else was marginal

I've been slowly turning into an oyster lover in the past year.  I just came back from a weekend in NOLA and I am a full-fledged oyster addict.  I actually went there twice over the weekend to eat the half-shell oysters and chargrilled oysters.

The first time I went, the oysters were nice, large and delicious especially the chargrilled oysters.  I've never had a better tasting oyster.  After you eat it, they give you sourdough bread to dip it in the monterrey, cajun spiced oil residue of flavor.  Sooo goooood.  The second time was just as good, but the oysters were a lil smaller.

I give it 4 stars because all I ate were oysters and a side of jambalaya (real good too).  I'm sure the rest of their menu is just as good.  I want to go back.

I'm so very pleased that I came here. I went twice in my week and a half vacation in New Orleans. 

I love the chargrilled oysters - the taste is really good, the cheese on top not overpowering, lots of garlic butter and a light char taste.

The raw oysters are so flavorful! Way more so than the asian buffet raw oysters I usually get in Atlanta.

Oysters here seemed to be slightly bigger than ones I had at other New Orleans restaurants. 

The etouffee is very incredible. The sauce is so light but very satisfying. Get the fried crawfish tails!

The veggie burger is really flavorful. If I needed more food to go with my oysters, I wouldn't hesitate to reorder the Acme veggie burger.

Bread pudding was lovely; sweet but not overly so.

I did not enjoy the crab cakes here and do not recommend them. Needed more spice. 

The wait from the edge of the building to being seated was about 20 min. It looks long but moves faster than you might think. Very worth it. I read somewhere that Felix's across the street has the same chef as Acme? The chargrilled oysters are near identical taste twins. Enter Felix off of Bourbon Street (as there is almost no waiting during dinner hours in Dec 17 - Bourbon street is under heavy reconstruction) if you just can't stand the Acme line.
Must try the chargrilled oysters! Bar area was really noisy so it was hard to talk/hear, but the bartender was so sweet!

While traveling I was invited to lunch with some coworkers. I showed up 2 minutes after they were seated and before they ordered drinks. I was told I couldn't sit in the empty seat they had saved for me because I didn't walk in with them. Walked to Deanies and had lunch alone. I don't really care how good their food is. Very rude and illogical management and rules.

Tried this restaurant based on strong Yelp reviews.  Ordered oyster shooters for the table to start out.  One of my friends immediately spit out the oyster as soon as it went in his mouth and he said they were the worst he ever had.  A couple of my other friends ended up not even taking theirs.  The atmosphere inside is fun and lively.  Service was a little slow but overall not bad.  Following my typical NOLA ordering pattern, I ordered the New Orleans medley which is a sampling of gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and grilled smoked sausage.  It tasted average to me.  Nowhere near as good as Oceana but not as bad as some of the other places I had tried.  Overall not a bad experience but not a place I would go out of my way to come back to.
They have really good grilled oysters.  We tried a few dishes and they are all quite delicious. The mixed drinks were too sweet and very low in alcohol.

With all the reviews and good feedback about Acme it was a must try while in New Orleans and wasn't let down ! The chargrilled oysters were by far the best thing there & best oysters I've ever had
Only reason I gave it a 4/5 star because the service was a bit slow but it was just because they are constantly busy

The raw oysters were very fresh. I loved the chargrilled oysters even more. The crawfish was also very well seasoned. I highly recommend these items. I also had a shrimp po boy. The bread was very soft and the sandwich overall was good. Be prepared to wait in line because this is a very popular place. Once the line was wrapped around the corner!
Bourbon Street was its usual smelly, seedy self, but Acme's food made up for it. I LOVE their bread pudding with whiskey sauce. YUM!
Decent.  Nothing to write home about.  More of a tourist trap serving expensive mediocre food.  Wasn't impressed.

Acne Oyster House was delicious. I feel the real winner on the menu is obviously the oysters. The charbroiled oysters were the real standout. We only ordered a dozen to start (since none of us really like oysters) we ended up eating three dozen in total. I will never look at oysters the same. So delicious! The appetizers are pretty good and really reasonably priced. The entrees were good, but not spectacular. The bread pudding with vanilla ice cream was the other item that we could have had ten helpings of. Overall it was a great dining experience and we would highly recommend.

Oh man I love this place. Sat at the bar with an awesome bartender, Curtis. We came in for a quick bite and stayed for a couple hours. Yummy beers and cocktails. And even better food! Oh the oysters...charbroilled oysters. So Good! The crab claws were my favorite and we loved the crawfish hush puppies. 

Obviously don't have to try hard to convince people to eat here. But you should eat here.

On a return trip with my coworkers, I thought we should come here- I liked it before, and it seemed like a good fit for our group.  Compared to my first visit, I was very disappointed, and don't think I'll be back on future trips.  

The line did move very quickly, despite us having a group of eight- I have that positive thing to mention.  The food was not very good for the cost, and the portion sizes were small.  I had an etouffee and chargrilled oysters again, and they were both disappointing.  The staff were terrible, actually- they rushed us, got a coworker's order wrong, and were not good about filling water glasses.
Just spent a week in New Orleans for jazz fest. Stopped by Acme three times for their amazing chargrilled oysters.
The grilled oysters were very good, but rest of meal just average including the Seafood Gumbo and Seafood Etoufee.  The Hurricane was good!

All you need in life are their chargrilled oysters, a feast for the gods. Your experience begins as soon as these babies arrive at your table sizzling with bubbly cheese and wine. Take a fork and dig in to the most savory delicious piece of sea meat you've ever had. The bonus? French bread to use as a sponge! Sop up every drop of buttery, cheesy goodness that's left on your plate.

Not as good as in years past. I asked about the fried fish po' boy and our waiter said it was very similar to catfish. I suspect he thought we'd never had catfish and wouldn't know the difference. It was nothing like catfish. About 25% of all of the food we got was over-fried. AKA burned. Yes, that's right. Burned. 

The peacemaker was good but see above about the burning issue.

I don't know -- I've been here on a previous trip and it was easily top on my list to return for a quick, casual lunch. I was very disappointed.

Great fresh oyster. We ate at the bar so it was kind of loud though. Spent around 30 minutes waiting outside the restaurant and they were a lot of people inside the restaurant. So if you are looking for quite nice place to dine in, it's probably not the best choice.:/

After seeing and hearing so much about Acme Oyster House, we were too excited to get here while on our BaeCay. Well... we must've come at the wrong time, because it wasn't what we were anticipating and definitely not worth The wait in line outside! The raw oysters were very small...and warm...not good! The plus was the shrimp poboys which were tasty, but nothing to rave about. I can say we ate here...that's about It! The oyster shooters were the highlight If that helps! Shrugs...

I ordered chargrilled oysters (so buttery, salty, and sooo good. the bread that comes with is very ok.), corn soup (pretty good - nothing special), and the soft shelled crab platter (fries were ok, the crab was good but very oily).

The best part (besides the chargrilled oysters) was the excited & happy service that they provided! they were chatting with us and even though they were packed with customers, they managed to smile and still be excited to meet each new group.

Make sure your whole party is there! no matter how long you've been waiting, and how cold it is, they won't let you be seated early :c

Went back to Acme this weekend.  I have to shoot my rating up to a five star because the chargrilled oysters were better than I remember.  And it's not even oyster season.  I was with a fisherman and he said he could taste that they weren't frozen from the season, but were picked fresh.  This still might be my favorite dish ever.  Yum!
Crawfish tails were my favorite, and I also loved the Boo fries.

Great charcoal grilled oysters. It's a great first date venue. Went mid week before 7, not crowded-were seated immediately. Staff is super friendly and were happy to give recommendation to first time customers. A staple in the French quarter!

Loved their charbroiled oysters! 
Don't bother getting the 1/2 dozen, must get a full order! Get the dozen! 

Things we enjoyed: 
Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy
Charbroiled oysters (dozen!) 
Seafood gumbo 
Bread pudding 

Things we didn't enjoy: 
Crab cakes

This was our second trip New Orleans, we visited here on our honeymoon last fall. A tour guide suggested had suggested it, and it was absolutely amazing! There was a line out the door, but that's not uncommon for New Orleans, and usually all the best places have a line out the door! Definitely worth the wait. I got a fried shrimp platter, and my husband got a catfish platter I believe. Holy moley, so good!!!!! As I'm sure you already know, the seafood in New Orleans is otherworldly and so unbelievably fresh. The batter was crispy and well-seasoned. We sat at the bar and were watching some of the prep cooks shucking oyster shells, so it really made the atmosphere of the place extremely authentic. It's down-to-Earth, dirty, delicious Cajun fare!!! The price tag wasn't bad either! Check it out!

Very high expectations, huge disappointment! The oyster is not cooked in right way and all seafood is deep fried~ when you come to New Orleans, you have high expectations for food. However, it is not the case for Acme, especially there is a long line in front the door. Find good food somewhere else! I would only recommend the soft shell crab, which is acceptable.

Service was awesome, lines very much so exist. I think there's unlikely a time when there isn't a line. It's bustling with people and everyone seems to know just what to order. We ordered the fresh and chargrilled oysters and, boy, were they good- the chargrilled is unlike any other baked or grilled oyster I've had- in short, it was amazing. The gumbo was not quite what we were hoping for (and neither were the fried crawfish tails) meh.. The soft shell crab was crispy and good, though!

The Oyster Rockefeller soup = must have. 

To top things off, we had such hospitable service! Talk about southern hospitality! I finally found it! :P

Perk: they have an awesome military discount :)

Will I be back? Ooooh, yes.
Long lines are an annoyance but this is worth the wait.  The chargrilled oysters lived up to the hype.  The fried peace maker po-boy was totally delicious.
Good oysters at a reasonable price.  Fried shrimp and oyster po'boy was really good too.  Definitely a place worth checking out.

This place serves yummy oysters!! I think it was about 10.99 for a dozen of raw gulf oysters. The oysters are pretty big compared to the ones we had in San Francisco for $1 a piece.  I love the chagrilled oysters!!  Boy, we had like 2 dozen oysters each that night :)

We found out that the airport has cheaper oysters at the Acme. It was like 9.99 per dozen.

Omg yum!!! GET THE CHARGRILLED OYSTERS! They're cooked in a garlic and butter sauce so even if you're not an oyster fan, you'll barely taste that oyster flavor. 

The red beans and rice with sausage was delicious too, probably one of the best I've had in NOLA. It was served in a warm bread bowl with 2 links of sausage cut lengthwise. 

You'll probably have to wait outside but the line goes fast!! Service was friendly and quick, which is always a factor when I write reviews. 

Would definitely come back :)
Not the best oysters you can get in New Orleans, but their gumbo is awesome!

Peacemaker po-boy was delicious. Luckily when we went there wasn't a wait, but I can't understand how people would stand in line outside, when Felix's is right next door and just as good.

Word of caution, one of our party had the soft-shell crab and did not like it at all. I was happy with my food though!

The place had a line out the door that stayed strong through the night.  We waited it out and were happy with the decision.

The oysters, of all varieties, were top notch.  Very fresh and tasty, even compared to other places on the block.

One person got a fried platter and the breaded white fish was absolutely fantastic.  Light, flaky, and extremely tasty.  I was impressed.

This was my first trip to NOLA and I would certainly go back to ACME, but perhaps I would try to beat the crowd....if that's possible.
We stopped in for lunch when we got to town! This place was packed with people before noon on a Thursday! The oysters were great, and so was the

Most delicious oysters ever! The seafood was wonderful. Can't wait to come back! The service is a little slow and I felt like my waitress couldn't wait to leave, but overall I would definitely come back.

This was the first time I've ever tried chargrilled oysters, and it was AMAZING! This was our first seafood restaurant we went to in our trip (9.14.18) and we had a blast trying the food here! We tried the sampler combination, and everything on it was delicious! It has jambalaya, gumbo, red beans, and rice. This was also our first time trying the etoufée. EVERYTHINNG IS AMAZING!

The Chargrilled Oysters are to die for! Yes, there is a huge line to get in but once you eat the amazing food, you will understand that it is worth waiting for. I was in NOLA for a festival at the time, but if I am ever in the area then I will  absolutely come back.

Been here a few times, and I have to say that while their food is great, their service is often slow and inconsistent.

----------------------

The wait outside is usually 5-10 minutes depending on your group's size. If you need to seat a party of 6+, be prepared to stand there waiting.

Staff is friendly but forgetful, often needing reminding of little things like refills or sauces. The servers lack attention to detail (not bringing out plates, taking utensils and not leaving new ones) and they seem rushed when you do manage to flag them down.

Food is quite good, and this would earn 4+ stars alone. Their chargrilled oysters really are worth the wait, and even their strong plate options are worth exploring. 

The overall ambiance of the restaurant is pleasant: loud and playful.
Not worth. The crawfish was NOT fresh and about half the portion I get elsewhere. Jambalaya was like warm. Hush puppies were nice. Oysters were ok. Not coming back. Too many other better options

Had to wait awhile as this is located on Bourbon Street, so that was expected. What I did not like was that they didn't tell you how long the wait was. You just wait in line, on a sidewalk near an alley which had two homeless men who were bugging everyone in line for change and yelling out nonsense. 

We finally got a seat at the bar and had to wait another 10 mins to order our food. Food took about 25-30 mins to come out. We ordered a dozen of the charred oysters, seafood jumbo, and boom boom shrimp. Once we were finished the check took about 20 mins as well. 

Wait: 1/5
Food: 4/5
Service: 3/5

Bottom line: I wouldn't wait over 30 mins for this place, but the food is definitely worth trying.

In New Orleans, you don't need to go far to find great food. Acme Oyster House is one of the best for great prices and down home goodness. The spicy steamed crawfish is delicious, and my favorite, the char grilled oysters are to die for. Everything is good, so just go there often or with a large group so you can taste each other's orders.

This was my second trip to Acme Oyster House and it was as good as the first visit. I started with the half dozen oysters - which were gone in two minutes. I think had the 1/2 shrimp and 1/2 catfish platter, with sweet potato fries. The shrimp were definitely my favorite part - it had to do with the breading I think. the Catfish lacked the same flavor and was just OK. The sweet potato fries were very good. I would go back for a third trip on another visit.

This is one of my favorite spots, in the U.S.! Obviously get the oysters (I prefer raw but chargrilled are good too). The gumbo is divine and the service is unbeatable. I like sitting at the bar and having discussion with the shuckers. The smell is very fishy but worth it. The medley is my goto meal but everything is good. Buy tshirt when you're there and make your friends jealous. Ha! Ask for Hollywood at the bar.
I don't like oysters... but I liked the broiled ones from here. I don't know if it was the cheese or what but this is the only place I'll ever eat oysters from. NO Staple!

Excellent food. Wonderful service. OINK OINK OINK. Had the combo appetizer: gumbo, jqmbalaya, red beans ans sausage. The food was everything you would expect /want it to be: hot, plentiful and delicious. Also had an oyster PoBoy, which was perfectly seasoned. The waitress efficient and never let my water or soda get empty. Definitely recommend

I love Acme! The chargrilled Oysters are to die for. The master shucker Hollywood served us and shucked our raw oysters. We enjoyed beans and rice with our meal. Our drinks were strong and good. I really enjoyed talking to shuckers and they were very welcoming. I looked forward to returning to New Orleans and coming back.

Ok, I've been to New Orleans several time years ago and went back recently and was highly disappointed at the Acme house. I know this is a New Orleans establishment but the lines were long, the service terrible, and the food not worth the hype. As we waited in line, we decided to eat at the oyster bar in order to be seated immediately. We were rushed through, food thrown at us, and the bill given to us way before we were ready to leave. Poor service and will definitely not go back.
I loved the chargrilled oystera the line is long but worth it.. Hope everyone enjoys. Specially if you are drinking... New Orleans Rock

I bookmarked Acme before we ever left Nashville, and the clerk at our hotel also suggested it.  We got there at 5:30, and the place was crowded, but we were seated immediately.  There was a fairly long line by the time we left.

We asked about their specialty drinks.  My wife really enjoyed her blue bloody Mary and I was really getting into the Acme Sunsets.  The chargrilled oysters were simply awesome.

Maria was our waitress, and she took very good care of us.  We followed her dinner recommendations and were rewarded with some great New Orleans specialties.  My wife had the NO Medley, with samples of sausage, gumbo, and jambalaya.  I tried a little of everything and enjoyed it as much as she did.  But my meal was even better than hers.  I had the ettoufee  with crawfish, and it was so rich and flavorful, and was just marvelous.

We finished up by sharing some bread pudding.  The whiskey sauce really made a difference.

Love this place!
Great atmosphere and incredible food.
Charbroiled oysters and seafood gumbo for lunch. Yummy!
